description:
This is absolutely DELICIOUS. This is an outdoor version of the one on Columbus. It was my first time here, dragged by my friends who were extremely excited. I have never heard of this place and I am honestly shocked I haven't. 

Baked bear is, as per the description in the title, is a custom ice cream sandwich place. It doesn't only have ice cream sandwiches, but plain ice cream and... it slips my mind now, but there's other things too. 

I had gotten a custom ice cream sandwich. I got a snickerdoodle cookie with mint ice cream and Oreo crumbles. It came in a tray and it was a little difficult to eat. But it was totally worth the messiness. It was delicious and tasted very very sweet. Now of course, if you don't like it super sweet (or want it sweeter), you can customize it. Don't want it sweeter? Choose a different ice cream or topper. Want it sweeter? Choose a sweeter ice cream or topper. It's wonderful! Instead of a cookie as the "buns", you could have a donut or brownie. 

(Longer description if you need it:)
It's completely outdoors and wonderful if it's sunny (like the day I went). On the left of the truck, there is a menu written in chalk. For a custom ice cream, it has each step written out perfectly. It starts with what you want as "buns". There is a list of cookies they have (and they have a monthly cookie which I think is peach cobbler this month), a donut, or a brownie you could choose. Next is a list of potential ice creams you could get. I highly recommend the bear one, I didn't get it but it sounds LOVELY. (Its blue cake batter, fudge, and brownie). Next is a list of toppings, which is placed on the side of the sandwich, stuck onto the ice cream. 

In the middle(ish) is where you order. To order, I said, "Hi! I would like a Snickerdoodle cookie with mint ice cream and Oreo crumbles." They take your order and you move to your right. On your right is the place where you get your order and pay. 

For utensils and napkins, it's on the table slightly on your right when you pick up your sandwich. There is seating in front of the truck (and towards the back...?). 

Overall, completely love it. :)) ALTHOUGH.... I'm not sure if it's worth $7. My friend thought it was super similar to Creme. Don't recommend going out of your way for this place but stop by if your in the area.
author: Naomi C.

description:
I came here with a friend on Saturday afternoon at around 3pm. Wasn't busy at all! It's around some other cute food trucks around Fisherman's Wharf. 

I got got the espresso bean ice cream with a peanut butter cookie and cinnamon oatmeal cookie and oreo cookie topping ($6.95 + 0.50 per topping= $7.45). I felt like the cookies were pretty undercooked. I wished the peanut butter cookie had peanut chunks or something to bring out the peanut flavor more. The cinnamon oatmeal cookie had a good balance of cinnamon, but I wish it wasn't so undercooked. The espresso bean ice cream was creamy and smooth, though the espresso flavor was not strong at all and I prefer chocolate chips or something mixed in with my coffee flavor (though I guess that's how they get you to buy more toppings). There also wasn't not enough oreo crumbs in my opinion. 

My friend got the cinnamon oatmeal cookie and an M&M cookie with cookies and cream ice cream and M&M toppings and whipped cream. She also thought the oatmeal cookie was undercooked, but she felt the M&M cookie was overcooked. She also felt while the ice cream was good, there was not enough cookies in her cookies and cream and it was just overly sugary. 

We forgot to get our cookies pressed, which probably would have elevated it. Wished the server would have asked us, but still on us for forgetting! If I was in the area, I would possibly give it another try.
author: April L.

description:
Walked by this place while I was exploring fisherman's wharf! This place is a truck-like place with outdoor seating. 

I just want to give a shout out to the lady who was handling the store all by herself the day I went. There were a big group of kids in front of me who were learning how to save and spend money i'm guessing, since they all paid in coins and only could order what they could afford. The lady was so patient with them!

My boyfriend and I ordered a funfetti cookie with a white chocolate macadamia ice cream sandwich. The ice cream we got was Bear batter! It was a bright blue! I think the funfetti went well with the bear batter ice cream. We also got our sandwich hot pressed. The cookie was soft, warm and chewy and the ice cream paired well with the cookies.

I love this place and would deff come back!
author: Flora L.

description:
Went at the very end of the night! Super delicious and great service!! I had the cookies and cream
Cookies with cookies and cream ice cream! (Obviously my favorite flavor!)
author: Jennifer K.

description:
9PM and we were looking for parking so we could eat dinner at the local In N Out, but then I saw The Baked Bear. I recognized it from an Insider video I saw a few years ago, and I even put it on my list of places to try out, on the off chance I would be in San Francisco. We spoke to the owner and he said he's going to close up the shop but if we order something now, he would stay open for us. Throwing all caution to the wind, we had dessert before dinner and split a brownie ice cream sandwich with the blue cake batter ice cream sandwich, drizzled with caramel. 

Man this sandwich was like my sweet tooth dream come true, but then on steroids. This sandwich was MASSIVE. I could see why we had to pay $7/$8 for it. The cake batter ice cream was creamy and subtly sweet (compared to the brownie), making it pair well with the brownie. The brownie had some crispy edges, but was ooey gooey on the inside. Just like how I like my brownies. He gave us lots of caramel syrup, which we appreciated. 

If we had not been so full from the sweets we ate from our earlier trip to MOIC, I probably could have pushed through so with the help of my boyfriend, we would have finished it. Sadly we were defeated and didn't even finish half of it. I would love to come back to The Baked Bear if I have the chance!
author: Liselle L.

description: Good.  Cookies need to be softer to keep the ice cream from squeezing out.  Great dessert!
author: Jeni A.

description:
Choose your cookie or brownie, add your ice cream, topping, and press it if you want it warm. Great idea in a heavy tourist area. Staff was extremely polite and accommodating. 
My chocolate cookie was soft and mushy, salted caramel ice cream was standard fare, nothing special. 
All for a whopping 7 dollars!
author: Stephen D.

description:
San Francisco rain and cold ain't gonna stop me from my love for ice cream!  The kiddo fell asleep in his stroller and it was my chance to break free and indulge in sweets without having to hide and sneak bites when he's not looking. Woohoo~  Excited was an understatement!

It was raining and so of course I was the only crazy person there.  I think the worker was surprised anyone even came 'cause I had to ask if they were even still open, lol.  I got to sample a few different flavors and the worker explained I could split 2 flavors if I couldn't decide.  There were so many choices which as a first timer can be overwhelming.  I like picking from a set of tried and true mixes, but that's just me!

The cookie I wanted only had 1 cookie left so I went with the cookies & cream and paired them with with the brownie dough swirl and salted caramel fudge ice cream.   My order was rung up right away which made me forget that I could & wanted to pick a topping.  It was also really dark so I didn't know I could get my sandwich hot pressed and missed it on the menu.  Oh well! 

The worker was really apologetic that the salted caramel ice cream was on the soft side, almost melted.  Kinda wish he told me that beforehand and I would've picked something else.  He ended up not charging me for splitting the flavors (didn't know that was an extra charge) and gave me 2 free cookies on the house.  Awesome!!  That was a really nice surprise and I always appreciate free food :)

I ran back to my hotel just 1 block away thinking that it would rain harder.  I tried to sneak a bite on my way there but the cookie was hard and the ice cream gushed out.  Once I got to my room the salted caramel already started melting into a pool of goop.  Nonetheless, it was really good!  I loved how the cookie still had a bit of that raw cookie dough taste and was still a bit chewy.  It would have been even better if I got my cookies hot pressed to soften it up (it doesn't melt the ice cream) and if the salted caramel fudge wasn't so soft.  This is definitely THE place to indulge in custom ice cream sandwich goodness.  

I'll be making this a regular stop every time I'm in the Fisherman's Wharf area from now on!
author: Maria P.

description: 5 stars and more for this Amazing ice cream place I tried today. All the flavors we tried were yum!! The music was amazing, the service was very nice and warm. The lady suggested us an amazing combination of cookie and baked bear ice cream, with Oreo cookies toppings and we loved it
author: Amar P.

description:
Hello!!!! Did someone say Build a Bear? No! It's Baked Bear, where you build an ice cream sandwich of your dreams!

Imagine you wanted two donuts with a brownie in the middle of it with two ice cream flavors like mint chocolate chip and vanilla. Well you can stop imagining and make it become a reality here.

If you can't decide on a creation, I'd recommend going on their instagram profile for ideas. Or you can just wing it because you can't go wrong with any sort of selection you choose to make.
author: Jacky C.

description:
Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh... yeah! 
Baked Bear is legit... 

I had only known  CREAM, until the day I learned about baked bear...

Sorry cream, we're through
author: Cal J.

description: What a magical delicious place this was. I mean c'mon you create your own ice cream sandwich. 10/10 would have again, and again, and again, and...
author: Abel A.

description:
This place is sooo good! Donut with birthday cake ice cream and sprinkles! I def don't recommended eating this stuff often but omg it's yummy! They warm the donut up which makes it way better! My daughter likes the cookies and my son enjoys the brownies. 
I do think it's overpriced for what it is but good for a once in a while treat!
author: Danielle B.

description:
If I lived in San Francisco, I would come here at least once a week! Their ice cream cookie sandwiches are unreal, and they have long lines to prove it! 

I ordered cookies and cream cookies with cookie dough ice cream with fruity pebble toppings! It was so delicious! The cookies were the thin kind and moist. This was a great combination! I'm salivating while composing this review! 

You can choose between a variety of cookies, ice cream flavors and toppings to customize to your liking. You can even choose 2 different cookies for your sandwich. They also have doughnut and brownie sandwiches available. It's locally sourced ingredients and everything is freshly made on premises. My only regret was only visiting this store only once while visiting.  I can still recall the smell of freshly baked cookies! !  Yum!
author: Samson L.

description: This is the cutest ice cream shop ever. They have the best flavors, and I got Bear Batter with two snickerdoodle cookies. The outdoor atmosphere is great, too.
author: Gabrielle R.

description: Was on the way to china Town and happened to find The Baked Bear- best ice cream shop I've been to in a long time. I got a brownie bowl with ice team and it AMAZING. Their ice cream sandwiches are to die for and you customize everything to what you want! Perfect snack for walking around San Fran!
author: Madeline P.

description:
The ice cream is delicious and the service is friendly. But let's face it, almost all ice cream in this part of town is delicious. The cookies are very bland. I guess if you are going to use the cookie to make an ice cream sandwich, it doesn't have to be very tasty. But we bought ice cream and cookies separately, and we couldn't even finish the cookies! Any of them! They were really tasteless.

They are also kind of mushy almost like the cookies are undercooked a little bit. I think they need to revamp the recipe. Try some baking powder!

Sorry, friendly service and good ice cream are a dime a dozen in this town. That's why I'm only giving it two stars.
author: Jim C.

description:
I completely adore the Baked Bear's Ice Cream Sandwiches, and if you're in the need of a sweet treat, you HAVE to come here and give them a shot. A definite hidden gem by the end of the North Beach pier and a complete recommend! 

I almost missed their location twice around it- It's kind of a hidden gem I would say! It's tucked behind the touristy pier on North Beach. Their location is basically out of a food truck, but there's 2 large tables in the front for maybe medium sized groups. They also have a small sign that reads The Baked Bear out front, but their location is kinda nondescript.

Conceptually in the Bay if you're familiar with C.R.E.A.M or Cookiebar, it's the same concept, only I appreciate the Baked Bear more bc for the charged set price (for me around $6 for their cookie ice cream sandwich) you can choose as many additional toppings as you like without getting charged more. I really appreciate how it's kept at a fixed price, so load on the toppings! I think I actually would put this on par with Cookiebar, and it might actually be one of my new favorite places to get an ice cream sandwich! They also have donut ice cream sandwiches here, which I'll have to get next time.

I ordered the custom ice cream sandwich, so I asked for 2 Red Velvet Cookies (ask for them to be warmed, it makes a difference, trust me!) with their infamous Bear Batter with Sprinkles and Fruity Pebbles on the side. 

The Red Velvet cookies honestly looked more like a chocolate cookie (it was more of a darkish brown than a red) but it was still soft and very chewy. Probably not my favorite red velvet cookies ever- But still pretty good cookies, soft and slightly chewy. I'd also ask to have them warm, as it really makes a difference and softens the cookie a lot. I'D RECOMMEND ASKING FOR YOUR COOKIES TO BE WARMED, TRUST ME! 

Their Bear Batter also really blew me away. Bear batter- Or their Cake Batter ice cream mixed with chocolate fudge chunks really impressed me- and especially since I'm normally not a fan of chocolate. The Bear Batter was sweet without being overwhelmed in their chocolate fudge chunks, and I'd definitely recommend that ice cream flavor.

I also appreciate how if you order their custom ice cream sandwiches or donut ice cream sandwiches, for the set price you're paying for you also get unlimited topping options included! I ordered the Fruity Pebbles and Sprinkles together and I was a happy camper.

The girl who was working was also very sweet and was really fast making the sandwiches, as the line was getting a little long (even though I came at around 9pm at night & it was chilly from the cold). Props to her.

I'd have to put the Baked Bear at 5 Stars. A total gem, if you're definitely near the Pier or even if you're in the mood for a bomb ice cream sandwich, you NEED to come by and try it here. I'd highly recommend and it definitely ranks near the top in terms of my favorite Ice Cream Sandwich spots in the Bay. Definitely worth coming here & checking it out!
author: Allison O.

description: Mouthwatering cookies. Dynamite ice cream. Pressed ice cream sandwich was mind blowing. So delicious. Worth every dime and all the wait. Absolutely returning!
author: Jeff S.

description:
One of my favorite spots in fishermans wharf. And each time I go I make a new creation! You can tell that the cookies are made fresh daily. Next time I'm going to try a sandwich with a brownie instead of a cookie! I've had the cookies and cream cookies and the chocolate chip. Both are delicious. I'm not sure if they make their own ice cream, but it's delicious and sure tastes like they do! They have a variety of toppings. This past time I did rocky road ice cream with mini m&ms. My boyfriend did chocolate chip cookies with vanilla ice cream and fruity pebbles. We will definitely be coming back!

Also-they need to sell water bottles! I like cold water with my ice cream as most people do, but they only sold juice and soda, which i think is sometimes too sweet to have with sweet ice cream! Other than that this place is great and friendly service.
author: Emily M.

description: Really good ice cream and fresh cookies. You get to make your own ice cream sandwich and can select any combination of two cookies and ice cream flavor. What a great treat!
author: Allan R.

description: First time trying The Baked Bear! I'm an ice cream person so I looked up great ice cream places that I could visit during my trip to SF. This place is top choice and for a very good reason! The service was great, the guys were super funny and really friendly. I went with the funfetti cookie, bear batter ice cream and caramel drizzle and my was it delicious. Their signature flavor, bear batter, is a blue colored ice cream and tastes like cake batter. I absolutely love this family owned business and definitely recommend both locations. If you're in the SF area, this is a MUST try!
author: Natalie N.

description: While in SF I came across this place on yelp! It's within walking distance from the Pier...they had great choices of ice cream and pastries for your ice cream...donut was really soft and moist and ice cream wasn't overly sweet. It was amazing! I only wish they had a fruity ice cream flavor ...maybe like a berry, orange, or a nice sherbet, that's my only downfall...other than that...I loved it & would be back
author: Elley E.

description:
Custom ice cream sandwiches!

This past weekend I had a chance to try one of their delicious custom ice cream sandwiches during a Chocolate Walking Tour that I participated in. 

Actually, I didn't choose to get an ice cream sandwich, I went for other creations instead and had the Bear Bowl. I wanted a warm chocolate chip cookie with my ice cream but they only had brownie bowls at the time. It comes with one scoop of any flavor ice cream. I chose cookies & cream with almonds for topping. It was refreshing against the warm afternoon weather in San Francisco. Delicious! 

So here's how you do it. Your custom ice cream sandwich can either be a cookie, brownie, donut or a combo sandwich (cookie + brownie)... this is the first step is deciding your top and bottom LoL! (you can mix and match any cookie, brownie or donut). Then you choose your ice cream! Easy, right? Wrong! because there's many yummy flavors! Choices! choices! Once you finish making your ice cream selection then choose your toppings! Now that you learned how to order your custom ice cream sandwich what are you waiting for... ready set go!  

This Baked Bear is located in Fisherman's Wharf between Jefferson and Beach Streets.  It runs off of a food truck and has picnic bench seating as well as bistro seats.

Review #0753
author: May A.

description:
It's been a hot minute since I sat down for long enough to craft another Yelp review. Between work and moving, there's been little time to enjoy my life, but at least I enjoyed some tasty ice cream!

The Baked Bear is located in tourist central in San Francisco; it's a hop, skip, and jump away from Pier 39 and the mobs thinking that SF is somehow cooler (in both temperature and attitude) than wherever they're from. They're wrong. The day I was here, it was a toasty 75 degrees out, and I had my nose out for delicious, sweet ice cream. If you're anything like me, you like your ice cream to have a fun spin to it, so getting a cookie, donut, or sundae to go with a plain Jane scoop is the way to go. My significant other didn't see the donut option when we opted to split our ice cream, but he did at least see the hot fudge sundae option when I let him choose.

Strawberry ice cream paired with a fudgy brownie is delicious, let me tell ya that. $6 isn't too bad for a hot fudge sundae of any kind, so to see it at a reasonable price near the Wharf was really cool. I'm sure the donut ice cream sandwiches are earth-shattering, because they're certainly aesthetically appealing. If the sugar content or the warmth of the sandwiches doesn't appeal to you, though, I'd spring for a plain scoop or sundae. The menu is incredibly extensive and customizable, and everything comes out quickly, so you should have no problem getting your fix.

All the seating is outdoor, which really sucks on the approximate 10 days out of the year SF is hot. However, rest assured your ice cream will not melt otherwise.
author: Gwen W.

description: Very very very tasty!! I am glad i stooped in for a treat. Choose the red velvet cookie (yum) vanilla ice cream with sprinkles and had it pressed. I ate in silence, savored every min of the delicious dessert. Staff was friendly!
author: Tia T.

description:
Very good ice cream. We got scoops which cost $4.50 and added a brownie to the coffee ice cream. Very good combo-by the way. 
We sat on the benches they provide. It was nice. Walking distance from our hotel. In the heart of Fishermans Warf.
author: Dominica R.

description:
CREAM at UC Berkeley and Diddy Riese at UCLA have a similar concept: selling ice cream sandwiched in freshly made cookies. I feel that the offerings here at Baked Bear are slightly better, however, because the cookies somehow taste fresher and home-baked, as does the ice cream, which is served more generously and feels home-made as opposed to ice-block cold.

Here, they can take the ice cream sandwich up a few notches with any number of toppings, glazes, or amped-up varieties like a brownie or donut sandwich. Ice cream on its own is also a good choice: again, lots of it at reasonable prices. 

This is a mere stand in an otherwise super-touristy area, but once in a while you can find a diamond in the rough where you least expect it.
author: Vincent L.

description:
What a cute little find! We knew we had to stop and experience this sugary delight and it was worth it! It's in the food truck area, next to the yummy Codmothers and the pizza truck. I wish I took pictures of what we ordered but it was inhaled quicker than I could say "The Baked Bear!" 
We ordered two of the one scoop ice cream cones that were massive and we had to try the chocolate chip cookie, coffee ice cream sandwich which was an absolute delight! With bigger ice cream companies in town, we wanted to experience and support these smaller businesses.
author: Lisa M.

description: DROOL. Today's special was the cinnamon roll cookie. I chose a cookie sandwich with cinnamon roll cookie, white chocolate macadamia cookie, birthday cake ice cream, and caramel drizzle. I loved the cinnamon roll with the birthday cake ice cream. The only downside was the ice cream froze my white chocolate chips a bit. I would suggest a cookie without chocolate chips unless you enjoy the crunch!
author: Lauren M.

description: Cant wait to return!  So DELISH.  The fresh baked cookies are. Hit alone but then add the creamy goodness of the ice cream and I was in hog heaven!!
author: Cynthia S.

description: Get the bear bowl.  Tin foil pan with a cookie baked in the bottom and a scoop of ice cream on top.  How could no one ever have thought of this before?
author: Jinx N.

description:
I LOVE ice cream & this place definitely did it for me!

Every time im in the Fishersman Warf area i stop by! One time at night they were out of donuts for the donut ice cream sandwiches, so dont go too late! Its a HOT SPOT! :)
author: Aaris S.

description: It was fun creating custom ice cream sandwiches here, but I thought the ingredients were just ok. I tried the coffee ice cream (good but not great), bear batter ice cream (too sweet for me), chocolate chip cookie (just ok), and brownie (pretty good). I had them heat up my ice cream sandwich, but it wasn't quite warm enough.
author: Janet M.

description: If you're ready to get cracked out on sugar this is your place! We got a bear bowl with brownie, birthday cake ice cream, and hot fudge! It was as delicious as it sounds. My boyfriend also got a cookie, because we really needed something more *insert eye roll here* the cookie wasn't overly sweet and at that point it was appreciated. For all your sweet tooth needs, I recommend this place. The girl  behind the counter was very sweet and gave us change out of her own purse for our dollar so we could pay for parking!
author: Ashley V.

description: Fabulous place with great ice cream/ cookie combos. I had a red velvet cookie and a cinnamon swirl cookie with mint chip ice cream rolled in Oreos. I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Andrea R.

description:
Filling enough to be a meal replacement.  In the Fisherman's Wharf area, but not overly touristy nor overpriced.  Open late, even when the wind picks up making the al fresco dining quite chilly.

Donut Sandwich w/ Birthday Cake Ice Cream & Fruity Pebbles: Love the donut sandwich, it's softer than cookies and sweeter than regular bread.  Also, the fact that they warm it up in a press then drizzle donut glaze on top is just great.  The birthday cake ice cream tasted like birthday cake batter.  It was decent by itself, but the combination with everything else is what makes it.  Speaking of, the fruity pebbles added a nice bit of color and crunch to the whole package.
author: Adam B.

description:
Great find around Fisherman's Wharf! I ordered the Donut Sandwich with birthday Cake Ice Cream, and Fruity Pebbles for my topping. Pretty sure that will always be my order when I visit (I am often in San Francisco for food).

It was so good! Great combination of sweets and flavors together. I tried to eat it like a sandwich/burger (obviously a terrible mistake) and my front teeth suffered the consequences. 

It's a little messy to eat, but a great dessert find in an area with plenty of lunch and brunch places you can visit beforehand.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: We found this place after eating on fisherman's wharf and it was the absolute best part of our anniversary. I had a doughnut ice cream sandwich and my husband had a cookie sandwich and they were so freaking good. Worth a trip to San Francisco just to grab these!
author: Cady B.

description:
I was here on a work training and was in mood for something sweet so I decided to try this place because I absolutely love Afters Ice cream from So Cal.

Anywayssss, I might just have to say that this place is better than afters.

I had the doughnut with bear batter and fruity pebbles.
It was to die for! All around delicious.
Definitely recommend it if you're in the SF area.
author: Monica T.

description: Another item I found in my scrap book that I forgot to review during my trip a few years ago. We walked by here while on the Warf and noticed these home made ice cream sandwiches. Of course it was busy with tourists. Perfect formula for families. It's a grab and go situation. The ice cream melts fast, therefore, this will get messy really fast. Staff were super friendly 'cause they know that it is a high tourist area. I had the chocolate chip with chocolate ice cream and sprinkles. Price was $$$ but it's the area.
author: Shila B.

description: Very good icecream sandwiches! You can ask to warm the cookies so it's melt in your mouth! Got white Chocolate macadamia and red velvet cookie with the blue Bear icecream and fruity pebbles. Diabetic heaven. Very sweet but oh so delicious! Near fisherman's wharf so perfect dessert after you have some clam chowder!
author: Joyce K.

description: Enjoy the ice cream here. Large selection of homemade ice cream's.  Try the homemade ice cream with a cookie.
author: Jorge A.

description: What's there to say . They freaking out my ice cream sandwich on a donut yummy...mint chip on glazed donut
author: Curtis T.

description: Great fun little gem right in the city. I was so excited to try a cookie ice cream sandwich! But when it was called the Baked bear with carnival lights I HAD to go right away. I pulled my husband across the street so fast lol . The strawberry ice cream was amazing!!!!!! I added the sprinkle cookie, a little to sweet for me but the taste was there. I would go back.
author: Ashley A.

description:
Think of Baked Bear like a more expensive version of "Cream" ice cream sandwiches.

They have basically the add your ice cream on your own cookie menu here.

The cookies didn't taste very fresh and one would think chocolate chip is a popular flavor.

The ice cream tasted like Breyers nothing to write home about.
author: Jack R.

description:
We were 
 honesty. 
About half way home I noticed I had lost my wallet. The baked bear was the last place I had it. I called in the morning and the manager Zana said she would ask the staff when they arrived and call me back. She called me back promptly and said it wasn't found. Bummer!  So time to cancel the cards and start replacing everything. 
The next morning she called me back. It WAS found. An employee found it and gave it to the GM, Emma. She was keeping it safe at their other location in North beach where she works. I arrived to retrieve it. Everything was intact! I tried to give her $20 to give to the employee that found it and she said 'No. This is our job to help and protect our customers." I argued with her awhile then asked her if I could at least give her a h7ug. She accepted and we shared a nice hug. Thank u Zana (sorry if I spelled it wrong)Emma, and your awesime crew. U really made my day!
author: Shelly R.

description:
Custom cookie sandwiches???!

What?


Now its not like this doesn't exist elsewhere but it's nice to see a place like this parked near a tourist place and do well.   Super tiny seating but it seems fairly busy during the nicer weather time.

What really caught my eye though were the lights and the sign.  Totally stands out amidst the hustle and bustle of restaurant row.

Totally delicious!
author: Ben H.

description:
I'm a fan of the end result!   Our custom ice cream sandwiches were lucious, creamy and just a perfect sweet end to the day.  Each one of us got something different but my son's was the winner:   cookies and cream cookies, cookies and cream ice cream.   Yum. Simple but goood. :)

That said...
...getting to it, trying to find parking, wading through the crowds....yuuuuuck.  It's in a very convenient location if you're going to spend the day at Fisherman's Wharf but not so much if you had it as a destination. (Guess I didn't research too much so I was caught off guard.)

Since it was the only place we were going to visit, I dropped off hubby and son and then drove around the block a couple times.  I wish there was a quick place to park - like a "15 minute zone" - but the closest parking was $8 for 1/2 an hour.
author: Heidi D.

description:
While exploring SF for the first time, I stumbled upon The Baked Bear! Though my initial reaction was something inappropriate...I walked closer and realized it was for ice cream sandwiches!  As cold as it was that day, I had to get one because there were so many good reviews!  And it helps that it smelled really good when you walk up to it!

I ordered Red Velvet cookies with Vanilla ice cream and fruity pebbles.  Besides it being picture perfect, the sandwich was delicious!  The cookie was thick and even slightly warm when I got it!  It was chewy and tasted very fresh.  They didn't skimp on the ice-cream either.  There was so much ice-cream in the end that I couldn't even finish it.  There are other items that they sell there, but the main event is an ice-cream sandwich. 

The service was fantastic as well.  There was only one lady doing everything...taking orders, making the order, and handling money...so it obviously took a little longer than expected, especially on a Saturday afternoon.  But overall, it was delicious and I couldn't ask for a better dessert spot to have stumbled upon!  So if you're in the Fisherman's Wharf area and want something to satisfy your sweet tooth, take a super short walk to The Baked Bear!
author: Jennifer T.

description: Cookie ice cream sandwiches!!!!!! My coworkers and I stopped by for dessert after walking around Fisherman's Wharf. Since it was almost closing time, they were out of a few cookie varieties. Luckily, they still had their Cookies n' Cream cookies available, and we ended up getting the Cookies n' Cream trifecta ice cream sandwich: Cookies n' Cream cookies, ice cream, AND topping ($5.95, https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=MYK0N__PKM6Tn2gitkXxZA&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg). This was DELICIOUS (the cookies were nice and chewy), especially if you are a cookies n' cream lover like me! The desserts are on the pricier side here, but it's about what you'd expect for a place around the Wharf area. I will definitely be back to try out additional desserts from here, and get more ice cream sandwiches! Parking was easy to find on a weekday night, but it's super crowded on the weekends!
author: Amy D.

description:
A friend told me about this place who makes donut ice cream sandwiches! This ice cream shop is off a side street on fisherman's wharf. You can make any custom ice cream sandwich with cookies and/or donuts. I tried the combo (one cookie and one donut). The donut didn't taste as fresh as the cookie. I overheard with the customer before me that they ran out of the Oreo toppings. It was about midday on a weekday. 

It's kind of pricey but the size of the sandwiches are big so you can easily share with someone else. Definitely come here on a hot day. They have a few picnic tables for you to eat on. The line is long but they take your order pretty quickly. You just have to wait for them to make it. They should pass out numbers because some sandwiches take longer to make than others. Hence it's confusing when a customers behind you are receiving their sandwiches before you while you wait.
author: Andrea B.

description: We had them cater a work event and they were awesome! They were incredibly nice , professional, and extremely accommodating. Two wonderful ladies came out and set up an ice cream sandwich station at my business and the goodies they brought were delicious. I highly recommend them and will use them again in the future. They serve all around the Bay Area, and the experience couldn't have been any easier!
author: Marie B.

description:
This place was amazing!

Does it get any better?!  Custom made ice cream sandwiches!  The cookies were crispy and chewy at the same time. Ice cream was soft and very creamy.  Soooo many options. Cookies, brownies, lots of ice cream flavors, lots of toppings... and you can even get it warmed! 

The staff was polite and very quick. They have lots of places to sit and enjoy your snack. 

We highly recommend checking this place out for a sweet snack.
author: A T.

description: Stopped in after all the great reviews... It was good, but too much hype!  Don't go out of your way for cookies and ice cream... I thing the ones at Ghirardelli are better.
author: Kelly P.

description: The perfect dessert! The brownies here are chocolatey and chewy. Paired with some strawberry ice cream and it's delicious! This is like the diddy riese of NorCal but a bit pricier. People working here are very nice!
author: Courtney N.

description: It's good! The cookie gets warmed which is amazing. You can add a second scoop of ice cream for just 50 cents more! Def. do a sandwich, it's one of the best deals there. A bit overpriced in the end if you're thinking about it but it's def worth the price. Way better than Cream!!!
author: Nerissa C.

description: Excellent ice cream place, food truck ice cream was awesome. The whole family enjoyed, possibly the best ice cream sandwich I've ever consumed! Would definitely go back next time  in San Francisco.
author: Ryan A.

description: Line out door must mean it's good. I enjoyed just a scoop and my cookies on the side for later but my wife and kids Allred enjoyed the cookie sandwich. Found parking right in front luckily. Near china town. Had some Chinese's playing instruments on the street and it sounded incredible. Great city ambiance.
author: Curtis C.

description:
A must stop for cookie and ice cream lovers like me! I am so glad I spotted this while wandering around Fisherman's Wharf on the way back from Pier 39! Just off the main drag and around 3:30, there was no line so I could easily take in the amazing menu. I got the M&M cookie with their special Bear Batter ice cream. The cookie was fresh and soft and the ice cream was delicious (and thankfully didn't turn my tongue blue!) I only topped it with sprinkles for ease of eating like a sandwich. My husband had snickerdoodle cookies with cookies and cream ice cream and no topping. For $5.95 it was everything I ever wanted from an ice cream sandwich! 

I am a big donut fan but didn't want something as substantial as the donut ice cream sandwich. However, a big thumbs up for that being an option!
author: Christina R.

description:
WOW! Stumbled upon this place, but glad we did. Choices, choices, and choices. We ordered one for each of us. Could have shared one, but on vacation, so what the heck. Wish I would have had them warm the cookies (pressed), but still a great desert.

Definitely needs to be a stop when in San Fran.
author: Scott M.

description: I got a bear bowl! This could not have been a more perfect dessert! The brownie on the bottom was warm and gooey. The ice cream on top was delicious and went perfectly with the brownie. We also got hot fudge. The staff was friendly and the outside seating area was cute and not too full.
author: Emily B.

description:
Kudos on the fun concept and excellent execution. Basically, it's a "choose your own adventure" ice cream sandwich stand. The cookies taste very fresh, and the ice cream is rich and delicious. Choose your toppings wisely! Points for incorporating Fruity Pebbles into anything, but you honestly can't really go wrong with anything here. 

The seating area can get a bit crowded with post-ice cream loiterers, but there's enough room to find a spot if you're patient.
author: Peter F.

description: This place is amazing. Definitely the best Custom Ice Cream Sandwiches in San Francisco. Sam was super friendly and recommended the Mint Chip and the Rocky Road as his favorite, and boy was he right about it.
author: Boban V.

description: Cute little ice cream truck right behind The Codmother fish and chips. Service was quick, And it's a cute idea to pick your cookie, pick your ice cream (all the basics) and basic toppings like sprinkles nuts whip cream etc. fun place!
author: Leesh P.

description:
Stumbled upon this after deciding to take my friends from out of town to Fisherman's Wharf.

Not going to lie, their music playlist alone probably deserves 5 stars but alas, I got to review based off food and service. 

So an ice cream cookie sandwich will run you around $5, which is the standard going price of such a treat in SF. What I love about this place VS Cream is that 

1. the people who run this truck are very friendly/lovely people
2. you get a free topping, yeeee
3. if you love cake batter ice cream, they have an awesome bear batter flavor for ya
4. good selection of ice cream/cookies
author: Arezou A.

description:
This place was delicious, owner was friendly and helpful.

Bear Brownie Bowl with Bear Batter Ice Cream....Enough said...

Cards accepted
author: Michael S.

description: Really cool ice cream sandwiches here. You can have a waffle sandwich, cookie sandwich, donut sandwich, or combo. I ordered a cookie donut combo with a fun fetti cookie, Bear batter ice cream, and donut. The bear batter ice cream was blue! It sure looked good but my sandwich was probably the sweetest tasting dessert I've ever had in my life.. way too much sweet for me so I would definitely order something different next time.
author: Jessica B.

description:
A fun spot near Fisherman's Wharf to get some cute, photogenic ice cream on a hot day that's super customizable and  not outrageously priced at ~$6 per sandwich.

My friend and I shared a birthday cake cookie with bear batter ice cream and rainbow sprinkles, and it was yummy!

The place is a food truck so we grabbed some to keep us busy while waiting for the street car across the street.
author: Tammy L.

description:
Great custom ice cream sandwiches!
Came here because of the great reviews and was not disappointed!
The birthday cake ice cream with frutti pebbles was the best!
author: Mayra L.

description:
I love ice cream, I love cookies, yet I've always hated ice cream sandwiches. All the places I've tried them at never seem to get it right. But...The Baked Bear has made a believer out of me. 

We ordered two sandwiches, one with chocolate chip cookies and one with funfetti cookies. The cookies here are absolutely fantastic. Crunchy in the right spots around the edges, soft and chewy on the inside. They weren't super sweet and the flavors were spot on. They also don't get soggy or fall apart even though they are packed with lots of ice cream.

The bear batter ice cream is my favorite. I wish I could buy it in stores. They didn't have all the toppings available the day I went, but the clerk suggested fruity pebbles and it was actually a great combo. Props for knowing your product well!
author: Jocelyn M.

description: Everything looked amazing (the hubby got cookies and cream cookies, cookies and cream ice cream and Oreos), but the price is pretty steep... $7 for an ice cream sandwich is too rich for my blood.
author: Carlee P.

description: In my opinion, this is the best ice cream I ever had in the bay area. I ordered a cookie sandwich with ice cream. I got the red velvet cookies with baked bear ice cream. The cookie was okay, it was topped with white icing and was not really the best cookie I tasted. However, I did like the texture of the cookie. The cookie's texture was very soft. The ice cream however, was absolutely delicious. It was the best ice cream I ever had in the bay area. I got the baked bear ice cream. It is made out of birthday cake ice cream mixed with blue food coloring and brownie bits. The ice cream wasn't too overly sweet and had a unique ( I cannot find this type of flavor around San Jose) and delicious flavor. I topped the ice cream with fruity pebbles and the fruity pebbles went well with baked bear flavor and really helped make the flavor more flavorful. My only complaint was that I was disappointed with the coloring of the red velvet cookie. It was almost as dark a chocolate coloring. It didn't look anywhere near red like the some old pictures posted here. Overall, I definitely will be back but only for the ice cream.
author: Criesiu L.

description: What can I say?  Fresh baked cookies, brownies, and donuts.  Homemade ice cream, all the toppings...
author: Justin Q.

description: Had the chocolate chip cookie with cookie dough ice cream. All together it was hella good.
author: Douglas D.

description: OMGGGGGGGG!!!! Cookies and ice cream til the death of me! Baked bear let's you pick any 2 cookies to make your very own custom ice cream sandwich. I got red velvet and birthday cake cookies with funfetti ice cream and fruity pebbles and sprinkles toppings. So freakin good!
author: Amar P.

description:
Get the Bear Batter.  That's the only tip you need.

Bear Batter is cake batter w/ Oreo's and fudge.  It is sweet, smooth, and creamy.  I'm a total chocolate person so I was basically in heaven after every bite.  Gavin  wanted chocolate and Tess wanted vanilla.  This was our last stop before heading back to our hotel.  

+ accepts cards 
+ fast service
+ limited menu but w/ unlimited possibilities 
+ brownies and cookies available for ice cream sandwiches
+ reasonable prices 

If you like sweets then this place is for you.  What diet?
author: Tram N.

description: Seriously ice cream! I had a cone and the crew all go different ice cream sandwiches. Delicious flavors & tons of options.
author: Annie F.

description: I found this place on Instagram, it was located right off Fishermans warf.  Unfortunately they were out of bear batter, I sampled it and it was delicious! I got two chocolate chip cookies with cookie dough ice cream. My extra topping was Oreo. The cookies were soft and fresh. You can also get your cookies warmed upon request! I thought this place had a good variety of cookies, ice cream and toppings. You can mix and match everything. You can also make your sandwich out of brownies! I really liked this place and would highly recommend it if you have a major sweet tooth!
author: Kelly O.

description: Their ice cream sandwiches are so delicious! If you have a craving for dessert, it will be more than satisfied here. Their cookies are moist and chewy, and ice cream has lots of cool flavors. It will be a sugar explosion in your mouth. Love this place!
author: Julia M.

description: Awesome ice cream and fun custom orders! I could go to this place every day, it's super good! The service is friendly and for the amount of items on the menu-everything is great! I loved the brownies and for ice cream I'd go for Bear Batter and Salted Caramel Fudge. You can go for any combination of of top, bottom, ice cream and toppings and will not be disappointed! Defiantly stop by the Baked Bear if you are in the area.
author: Ece K.

description: Delicious!! A must try while in San Francisco! The brownie with the Bear Batter ice cream is a must! So good! Everything is fresh and different.
author: S M.

description:
Came here with my cousins and decided to be adventurous with my taste buds. They have a variety of dessert combinations to choose from. I ended up going for their famous baked bear batter ice cream smashed between two glazed donuts. 
Tell me that isn't adventurous. My cousins got their ice cream on top of a cookie. It was a cool experience & recommend that you make a stop. One time for the one time!
author: Krisgen A.

description: This place had one of the best donut ice cream sandwhiches I have ever had! I really enjoyed their cookie monster ice cream! Their cookie ice cream sandwhiches are really good too! I dont think you can go wrong with any combinations
author: Tiffany W.

description:
We just missed the chance to order late-night delivery after we discovered this place and so made a special trip on our last day in San Francisco. It was so worth it! We arrived as they were opening but they had every flavor of cookie and ice cream ready to go.
In addition to the novelty of getting to combine everything you're craving into one sandwich or sundae, this is seriously some great ice cream! My choice was the salted caramel fudge ice cream in a sandwich with a cookie top and brownie bottom. Two friends got sandwiches with the Bear Batter ice cream and really liked theirs as well.
Service was quick and the owner was so kind, a really sweet lady. I would definitely take the chance to go back again, or order that delivery when an ice cream craving strikes.
author: Maya L.

description: A lot of choices and friendly staff. They were out of a few cookies when I was there but they made good suggestions for what was available. Arrive hungry!
author: Monica M.

description:
The fact that this place lets you customize your own ice cream cookie sandwich is why I'm giving them 5 stars.

I got the chocolate chip cookie, cookies & cream ice cream, and fruity pebbles topping and it was delicious. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a sweet treat.

Pros:
- customizable
- not overpriced
- quick

Cons:
- melts fast
- big portion (this can also be a pro)
- too many options to choose from (note the sarcasm)
author: Gloria P.

description:
This place is a SUGAR HEAVEN! 
The cookie of the month was cinnamon bun. So we got that cookie with their bear batter ice cream (blue cake batter fudge and brownie) topped with sprinkles, fruity pebbles and Oreo crumbs! Needless to say it was amazing, yes it was overly sweet but we do you expect with an ice cream cookie sandwich?! Go sugar overload or go home!
$5.95 + 50 cents per topping

Much love,
Canadian tourist that really loves sweets
author: Sally W.

description: Great ice cream. The hot chocolate and the sundaes were delicious. I would recommend this to anyone who loves ice cream, brownies, cookies, or other sweets.
author: TropicalNights ..

description:
The coffee ice cream was top notch!  The cookies were good, but they were on the small and thin side.  Toppings are 50 cents each.  Ice cream sandwich is 5.95.  Seems pricey to me.

This place is reminiscent of Cream and Didi Reese in LA.  I feel like both of those place are significantly less expensive.

If you want to treat yourself or your sweetie, this is not a bad place to stop, especially if you are doing the tourist thing in the area.

I would suggest they have larger cookies if they want to try to justify this price.  The alternative is drop the price to something more reasonable.  Maybe there are different prices for different locations and this one was just up there b/c it is right in the middle of tourist town.
author: Ty C.

description:
Don't get me wrong, Baked Bear is super sweet and not good to eat all the time, but HOLY CRAP, when you want to treat yourself, go treat yoself!! 

Baked Bear is a great play off your regular cookie sandwhich, you can get a brownie bowl or a donut ice cream sandwhich. HOMAIGHADDD....  I highly suggest the cookie ice cream sandwich, no..the bear bowl, wait no no the freaking donut stuffed with their bear batter ice cream (cake batter with chocolate chip pieces). So many options to your sweet tooth's desire. Who needs a gym membership when you can buy happiness for about $3.50-5??? 

But in all reality, Baked Bear is great every once in a while and pretty awesome for pictures, but there was nothing very special about it. For about 5 dollars for the equivalent of a sugar heart attack, it is just alright. If you haven't tried it, it is worth trying though! There is also another location in North Beach which is less touristy and is indoor, but the quality at this one is so much better and the staff is nicer.
author: Eric Joseph D.

description: While wandering San Francisco for a few hours, I decided to indulge in a chocolate chip cookie with salted caramel fudge ice cream and mini chocolate chips. It was delicious! The staff was very friendly and the seating area was clean and had areas to sit in the shade. Would return!
author: Monica Q.

description: Loved it! You can't go wrong with custom ice cream sandwiches! If you are in the area, stop by and give them a try...super yummy!
author: Felicia C.

description: Sooooooooo goood! Bear batter ice cream, with chocolate chip cookie/funfetti cookie and vanilla ice cream.
author: Brady C.

description: We stopped by randomly and I was super impressed.  I had a bear bowl w/brownie and my husband had one as well. It was so good we demolished it before a picture could even be taken.
author: Tianna R.

description: Stopped by because my daughter found this place on yelp. When I walked up to it, I was caught off guard because it was a food truck.  I didn't think treats were fresh but boy was I wrong. The food truck has ovens and their baked goods are absolutely fresh. I ordered a brownie that was so soft and yummy. My daughter ordered their ice cream stuffed doughnut.  You won't be disappointed that's all I can say!
author: Monica C.

description: Really yummy and it's super customizable. It's both yummy and affordable, definitely a place I'd come back to more than once if I lived in SF.
author: Denisa P.

description:
The BEST Custom Ice Cream sandwich you can get near Fisherman's Wharf!

My girlfriend found this awesome place on yelp and wanted to treat me for my 25th Birthday. It's a small shop that has the biggest heart! Not only do they have cookie ice cream sandwiches, they also have brownie sandwiches, and donut sandwiches! Say whaaaaat!?!?! They even have bowls in case you don't want it to be so messy.

When they say custom, they mean it. They have lots of different freshly baked cookies to choose from like red velvet, smores, choc chip, bday cake, etc. Then you choose your ice cream center. We both got the bear batter (cake batter with brownies and fudge?) which she loaded with like 2-3 scoops! Then you can cover it with a wide variety of toppings. I got half of mine covered with fruity pebbles and then oreo bits. Not only was the taste surprisingly amazing, it made for awesome snaps and IG pics haha!

Emma was so fantastic and sweet (like her desserts hehe!) She was so kind as to treat and greet me on my birthday! The price is pretty good considering how stacked it is when you get it. If you're ever near the pier craving something adventurously sweet, I'd highly recommend the Baked Bear. It's pretty cool!
author: Ryan J.

description: This place was great. They have an excellent cookie to ice cream ratio. If you like to mix things up, they give you the option to pick a different top and bottom cookie. You can also also warm up the cookies, which I recommend. Try the white macadamia nut cookies with strawberry!
author: Thomas D.

description:
I will give them 3.5 stars but since they don't have half stars 3 it is. I so badly wanted to be in love with this place but I wasn't completely wowed. I came across The Baked Bear on Utrip and researched them. Once looking them up I just had to try their ice cream sandwiches because they totally looked amazing!! Well as they say looks can be deceiving. 

My husband and I got here and walked up to the window to order. Once I got to the window I noticed a whole lot of under baked cookies in the window. We all like a "slightly" under baked cookie every now and then. However, one that the entire center is undone and looks greasy except a thin line around the edge is a bit weird. I looked at the Red Velvet one because that was what I was going to get that it looked ok. The Red Velvet cookie had a glaze drizzled over the top. I ordered the Red Velvet Cookie paired with Cookies & Cream Ice Cream. My husband ordered a Brownie Sandwich paired with plain Vanilla Ice Cream. 

Let's start with my husband's because his was the better of the two. His was actually the bomb dot comb. Well the brownie was. The brownies were cooked perfectly and had chocolate chips in them to add he perfect crunch. One of the best brownies I have had. The ice cream they serve is not anything special by any means. It tasted like they went to the store and bought carton ice cream. The vanilla ice cream was just nice to have with the brownie but it didn't taste like anything to rave about. Now for my ice cream sandwich. The Red Velvet didn't taste like anything. It almost tasted like the brownie in the sense of chocolate flavor but it did not taste like Red Velvet. It tasted like a chocolate cookie. Not what I was looking for. It also was a tad under baked which wasn't the worse thing but was like meh..ok. My Cookies & Cream Ice Cream too tasted like store bought ice cream. You couldn't even hardly taste any Oreo chunks. Like where's the crunch? Come on! So I didn't even eat mine. I took a few small bits and ate some of the ice cream. I just helped my husband finish his. : p

Overall, maybe this was a bad day or I went to a location that just doesn't produce as well. I think I simply give them 3.5 stars for the brownie ALONE. Everything else was nothing to talk about including the ice cream. Considering they aren't a brownie spot is why they aren't getting more stars because I have to rate them based off of what they are selling as a whole. I'm sorry, but as a whole I just wasn't super impressed. Maybe whoever is reading this will have better luck or just order the brownie.
author: Tiffany D.

description: I personally don't like cookies and ice cream together, but today I decided to give it a try. I went for the super blue ice cream(it was too pretty to skip out). Bear batter is cake batter flavored ice cream with fudge pieces. The cookie I got for the sandwich was snickerdoodle, also not a fan of. The total came out to be $6.45 which isn't bad for the size of the sandwich. Gave it a try and it was definitely not my cup of tea. It's way too sweet and I couldn't really taste the fruity pebbles bc of how sweet the ice cream was. You can also get it with a donut bun or brownie as well as heating it up. They have tables too so you don't have to stand while eating your sandwich. This place is a great alternative to LA's Afters Ice Cream where they're famous for their donut ice cream buns.
author: Lisa W.

description: I have no words for this place. Everything is amazing. It's done so well, isn't messy, taste is on point... just go. Please go. You'll see what I mean. I came here on my birthday and I got a birthday cake ice cream (obv) donut sandwich with sprinkles. It was everything I had hoped it would be and I didn't even miss having actual birthday cake (this says a lot considering I go insane for cake). I will 100% come back here to try more amazing flavor combinations (bear batter on chocolate chip cookies, I'm looking at you). Do yourself a favor and go try it. You won't regret it!
author: Pooja C.

description:
Oh MAN! The Baked Bear is a little ice cream food truck located at the Fisherman's Wharf in SF - a cold location to eat your cold ice cream :) There is some outdoor seating so passerby's can see you scarf down the deliciousness, but just remember to bring a sweater! 

I took my boyfriend here for his birthday for some dessert. We came here on a Sunday night around 6:30 PM. The line didn't look too ridiculous, but it actually turned out to be very slow because there was only one person working. That was okay with us! We waited patiently, which allowed us ample time to think about our creations. 

The Baked Bear has 4 types of ice cream sandwiches: 
1) cookie, 
2) brownie, 
3) cookie AND brownie, 
4) DONUT. 
They also offer Bear Bowls (cookie in a bowl with ice cream on top). You can choose from a variety of ice creams, but they have a unique flavor named "Bear Batter" which is blue birthday cake, fudge, and brownie bits!!!! YES!! 

We waited in line for a while and when it was finally our turn, I learned why. Emma, the sole worker providing us with ice cream deliciousness, was treating each and every person with great customer service. She thanked us for waiting, listened attentively while my boyfriend said what he wanted, and she repeated it back to us. Even when my bf had a special request, she said "Sure, of course we can do it! Why not?!" It was then that I said it was his birthday, and she said his ice cream was going to be on the house! Emma, thank you for being so genuine and kind while there was a nonstop line outside for ice cream. You're the best! 

I ordered a funfetti cookie ice cream sandwich with bear batter ice cream and sprinkles. The cookie stays soft, the brownie and fudge in the ice cream were on point... Honestly it's all I've been thinking about for the past couple of days. I can't wait to go back and get that bear batter!
author: Lena C.

description:
Leave room for a Baked Bear sandwich when opting to eat in Fisherman's Wharf; you won't be sorry unless you're on some fitness challenge. Though we had to wait for about 10 minutes, our sandwiches were swiftly prepared and worth the wait.  I opted for a high-calorie sugar rush courtesy of the following combo: Cookies and Cream cookies, Birthday Cake batter, dipped in Fruity Pebbles.  My cookies were thin but Oreo yummy.  My daughter chose Oatmeal Cinnamon(she found them too spicy) with Vanilla covered in sprinkles.  She abandoned the cookies and finished all of her ice cream.  Thanks Yelp fam for steering my mom-daughter Labor Day outing to foodie heaven!
Review#550!
author: Julie C.

description:
I've been wanting to try The Baked Bear for a while. We ordered a donut sandwich with the baked bear ice cream, rolled in rainbow sprinkles. YUM! The donut was super soft. Poor girl was by herself, so it did take a while to get our order in. But she was pretty quick to make it. 
I asked if the donut is glazed and she said yes. Apparently the donut is plain and once she prepares the ice cream inside, rolls it in sprinkles, she glazed it herself by drizzling the glaze on top. I would've preferred to start off with a full glazed donut all around but It was still very good. I would definitely come back for an ice cream cookie sandwich next time I'm in the neighborhood!
author: Nari M.

description:
I was craving donuts and ice cream and luckily my boyfriend found this place! 

Came here on a Saturday night around 9pm and it was pretty much empty. I got a donut cookies and cream ice cream sandwich topped with Oreo and the bf got a donut birthday cake topped with fruity pebbles. 

They have a wide selection of cookies also and all their ice cream flavors sound bomb! Will definitely be back.
author: Shana N.

description: Sooo goood! Everything was perfect! Flavorful and fast! Love the birthday cake batter!
author: GiGi M.

description:
Perfect little ice cream spot near fisherman's wharf with great ice creams and toppings, but also ice cream sandwiches and really yummy cookie and brownie bowls. Had a brownie bowl with chocolate and was so decadent.

The owner is super nice and opened up in a row where a bunch of food trucks / BBQ places generally are, but seems to be doing really well.

Nice patio seating. Definitely stop by.
author: Bob K.

description: The Baked Bear is my new personal favorite ice cream spot in the fisherman's wharf area. The customization makes it fun and their ice cream and cookies are high quality.
author: Brian G.

description:
Now we're talking. Folks I've had countless memorable ice cream experiences around the world, but just about every time I I find some ice cream that I really love I find myself wishing I could enjoy it stuffed between two quality cookies. The Baked Bear has capitalized on that concept and upped it even further with excellent results. 

Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?

Like the other spots in the area, The Baked Bear is a stationary food truck, but they've added seating and have built up a charming atmosphere by way of signage and friendly folks behind the counter. Star Granted. 

Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?

Given that with an ice cream sandwich you're really getting two completely separate items combined I understand the price premium that's in play; and I wasn't devastated by the $5.50 price tag on my doughnut ice cream sandwich, which is one of the most expensive items on the menu. Star Granted. 

Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?

I mean what can you say really? The degree of customization, rotating flavors of ice cream and cookies alike all brought together by the fact that it's all homemade is an unbelievable combination, and if you don't like what you ordered it's likely your own fault.

Was this the best donut I've had in my life or the best vanilla ice cream? It wasn't, but the fact that I had countless options with which to construct my favorite dessert combination was in and of itself rewarding. Single Star Granted. 

Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?

The Baked Bear has finally come together and capitalized on the best dessert trend in the game, and their degree of customization is something that would bring me back daily. Star Granted.
author: Paul V.

description: Perfect place to satisfy your sweet cravings! We got the donut sandwich with their signature bear batter ice cream topped with fruity pebbles and Oreo crumbs and it was sooo good. Our treat came out to almost being $6-$7 which is pretty pricey but definitely worth it.
author: Jessica L.

description: A must stop if your nearby.  Parking sucks but that's city life!  Kiddos were extremely happy!!  I mean what kiddo doesn't like fruity pebbles.  Lol. Everything looks really tempting and owners were friendly.  Sugar Overload!!  We will be back
author: Lissa C.

description:
Thanks to the Cream franchise, ice cream sandwiches are currently the avant-garde snack. 

The Baked Bear Company has opened and replaced the Codmother fish and chips, which moved around the corner and replaced another food site. 

When I stepped up to the truck, I was greeted by the friendly people. Looking at the menu and for my ice cream sandwich, I get to choose between six different cookies, twelve choices of ice cream and an optional topping(s). 

But I decided to bypass all those steps, I decided to get the ice cream sandwich of the month posted on the menu, which is the Salted Caramel sandwich. For $4.50, I get a scoop of salted caramel ice cream sandwiched in a pair of warm and gooey salted caramel cookie. Initially I thought this was another one of my abnormal eats. But the ice cream had a great caramel taste and gooey caramel sauce was strong enough to bond against the wrapping paper. The price is slightly higher than Cream's. But in return, we get friendlier and refined service here. 

As some of you have read from my "Quick Tip", if you live in North Beach, you get 10% off your bill. A little helps. 

The Baked Bear Company has only been opened for a few months and is ready for the tourists in the summertime. I would definitely be committed to be a regular here too.
author: Matt G.

description:
This ice cream sandwich and cookie shop appeared conveniently after I had my dinner of clam chowder and lobster roll on Fisherman's Dwarf. I was looking around and craved for something sweet and noticed this shop. It's a great concept and very indulging. My visit to San Francisco during this time was during July 4 and it was pretty cold. I didn't care though since I'm a huge fan of ice cream and warm cookies combo. I liked how they let you customize your own instead of just offering set premade options. 
You start with a choice of your favorite cookie/donut, ice cream ,toppings and the option to warm the cookies. There is a choice to mix and match your cookie for the top/bottom. I went with 2 white macadamia cookies warmed and rocky road ice cream with no toppings. I loved every bite although I had to share since it was getting too sweet for me to finish the whole ice cream sandwich. The prices are fair, expect to spend about $6 average for the cookie sandwiches and $4.50 starting for scoops. You can also order just the cookies which is a nice option to have as well. I'll definitely be back during my next trip to San Francisco.
author: Tran N.

description:
This place does custom ice cream sandwiches - much like Cream, but taken to the next level. The premise: Why should ice cream sandwiches be limited to cookies, when there are so many delicious baked goods in the world? That's just discrimination. 

At the Baked Bear, you can have your ice cream sandwich with COOKIES (tonight's selection: chocolate chip, funfetti, red velvet, and white chocolate macadamia), BROWNIES, freshly-glazed DONUTS, OR ANY COMBINATION THEREOF. Whaaaaaaattttt?! Amazing. 

They have a bunch of different flavors of ice cream, as well as "toppings" (side-ings?) that they'll roll your sandwich in. Or you can get it as a sundae, in a brownie bowl. Good luck deciding.

I got a combo sandwich, with salted caramel fudge ice cream between a brownie and a donut, rolled in fruity pebbles. Let me repeat that: tonight, I ate a thing that was part brownie, part ice cream, part donut, and part cartoon-inspired dry cereal. Using my hands. I love America.

And the thing was super well-constructed. I was pleasantly surprised; I was sure it would be a mess and fall apart/drip everywhere, but it stayed all together!

However, there were some service-related hiccups. First of all, I'm pretty sure they put the wrong ice cream in my sandwich. It was nonetheless delicious, so I ate it anyway, but still. Also, the lady who took my friend's order just disappeared and never made his sandwich, so after waiting around for a while and then realizing she had straight up disappeared, he had to butt back into line and order again. If it weren't for that, then this place would be 5 stars for sure.

I'm sure I'll be back!
author: Liz F.

description: I like this place better then cream. The cookies were fresh and soft. The ice cream was great as well. I had the cookie monster ice cream.
author: Casey W.

description: Definitely get a cookie sandwich here or your missing out! Their cookies are fresh, warm and soft- so good. They have a wide variety of cookie flavors to choose from and tasty ice cream flavors. I recommend the blue baked bear ice cream which is cake batter, brownies and fudge. Baked Bear ice cream sandwiches are the best I've had compared to similar places in the bay.
author: Jenine G.

description: Such a cute place. Cookies were not soft like I expected, they had a little crunch to them which I liked. Great cookie options. I've cream was delicious. Quite a messy snack but worth it.
author: Cerise C.

description:
I was ecstatic to come across this ice cream truck in SF a day after Nique F. posted her mouthwatering bear bowl confections! Located off Beach and Jones streets, it's right next to Carmel's Pizza, which I also had the pleasure of trying. 

My cousin and her friends had a difficult time choosing what to order, myself included! The workers were super nice and patient, offering us cookie samples of flavor of the month: strawberry cheesecake. So good!! It's pink, has a light dusting of pink sugar sprinkles, and tastes like the cream cheese batter is in the cookie itself. I almost thought it would have CC chunks. What sets their cookies apart from franchised competitors like CREAM is how soft and chewy they are. I had one the following day and it still melted in my mouth. Ahhh. Eventually settling for a brownie bear bowl with a humongous scoop of mint chip ice cream, I opted for hot fudge topping, fifty cents extra. The brownie got too indulgent for my taste, so much ganache at the end. 

You can ask for two ice cream flavors in the bowl or in a sandwich. They put the latter in a paper tray and you can use a fork to eat it instead of resulting in sticky fingers. Cookie/brownie/doughnuts can be mix and matched for sandwiches. One in our group ordered the doughnut sandwich with icing drizzled on top, when I looked back it was gone! Must've been that good, and it was shared between two people ;-)

They accept card! Ample amount of seating for at least ten. Go get your ice cream & cookies-- what are you waiting for?!
author: Kristine F.

description: Icecream alone was okay. I got rockyroad and mint. Feel like the flavor lacked. I'll have to try the cookies next time. My friend got the cookies and said it was good. It's a cute place and enjoyed getting the chance to sit down and relax while eating.
author: Cathy M.

description:
Every part of my Baked Bear experience was great. The lady in the truck was so nice. The ordering was comprehensive. The ice cream was unique and tasty. The cookies were cooked to perfection.  

While I did get basic chocolate chip cookies, they were just the right amount of soft. I went out on a limb to get the bear batter blue cake batter ice cream. It was the right choice and truly a flavor that I have never had before.
author: Joey T.

description:
Tried The Baked Bear in Fishermen's Wharf area next to Carmel Pizza on Jones St.  I went on the Grand Opening Day and it was FREE, regular price for a ice cream sandwich is $3.95!

I had to wait maybe 20-30 minutes in the hot sun, guy gave us some samples of their cookies. When I finally got to the window I picked strawberry shortcake cookie, coffee ice cream, and a chocolate chip cookie.  It tasted a tiny bit better than CREAM which is similar.  Cookies are a little better, ice cream average.

Good for the tourist that visit the area.
author: Ann L.

description: This place is fantastic! Lots of cookie and ice cream flavors to choose from and the service was fast and friendly. I had chocolate ice cream with chocolate chip cookies and it was almost more than I can handle. My daughter could not finish her dessert. If you're looking for a way to satisfy your sweet tooth, this is a must-do!
author: Chip A.

description: A 21 year old, 13 year old and 8 year old give this the max stars!  Two bear bowls with freshly baked warm and delicious brownie on the bottom topped with a generous scoop of ice cream.  Blue bear batter ice cream was surprisingly delicious!
author: Kathy T.

description: Really great place! Great customer service, patient, & not overly sweet! i finished my double double ice cream sandwich and still wanted more.
author: Eric M.

description: Overall, a pretty good ice cream sandwich place. I mean, the cookies were fresh and the ice cream was creamy and had the perfect consistency. I would recommend this place if you're in the area
author: Jade L.

description: I would give this place 76 stars if I could!! My siblings and I all got different ice cream sandwiches and they were all devoured rapidly. I posted some of the pictures so you can check them out. The baked bear is open late and is so much fun for mild san fran nights by the pacific! I highly recommend this place!  If you are lactose intolerant, then I don't suggest it but just know that you are missing out .
author: Brendan L.

description:
I'm a sucker for desserts so when I saw that this was opening I had to stop by and see how it was. I think I'm between a 3-3.5 for this place. 

I customized my own cookie ice cream sandwich and ended up choosing red velvet cookies with birthday cake ice cream . The combination was YUMMY highly due to the ice cream more so than the cookie. The red velvet cookie was not really that great and I would not recommend it nor get it again. It did not really taste like red velvet and I did not enjoy the white frosting? like part that was on top of the cookie. The birthday cake ice cream on the other hand was AMAZING. The cookie I would give a 1.5-2/5 and ice cream a 5/5. 

I also tried out a few of the other cookie flavors. Overall the cookies are all incredibly soft which is just how I like my cookies and they are not overly sweet which is great.

Snickerdoodle - 3/5 It tasted a little more sugar-y than cinnamon and I like my snickerdoodles to have more of a cinnamon taste.

Funfetti- 4/5 This was pretty good and what I expected from a funfetti cookie. I think this would taste amazing with the birthday cake ice cream and would love to try the combination together.

Cookies and Cream - 4/5 My favorite of the 4 cookies! It is not much of a strong cookies and cream taste but I really enjoyed the cookies and cream cookie the most! You cannot go wrong with oreos and cookies.

Overall, this is a pretty good dessert area around the wharf but I think some of the items are hit and misses. I love the idea and I love how you can customize your own sandwiches by choosing your own cookie, ice cream and toppings but I was not really wow-ed by any of the items other than the ice cream.
author: Julia K.

description: The most original ice cream store I've ever been to. The bowl with the brownie and coffee ice cream. Pure heaven!!
author: Sandra B.

description:
Nothing beats consuming one thousand calories of creamy, sugary goodness after burning a hundred calories walking around the wharf. 

Except...

Consuming an additional thousand calories from the fantastic fish and chips stand around the corner ;)
author: Ben G.

description: My fiance liked the taste of his ice cream sandwich, but it was falling apart as he ate it and he had to eat each part seperately. The price and distance from the Pier was ok.
author: Lani M.

description:
The old lady was unpleasant. Lol
Ice cream place should be a happy place to be but she was completely mean and unhappy.
author: Pussiekunt B.

description:
The cookie sandwiches were delicious and the lady serving the sandwiches was super nice so it was a win win. It is a small outdoor seating venue but overall It was clean and they were playing good music. 

The lady even gave us some free cookies for the road as we left. If I am back in San Francisco I will definitely be back!
author: Ryan K.

description: Cool place to stop while you're in the warf best cookies best ice cream and it's fresh unlike other places that will serve you freezer burned ice cream yuck!!! Everything is fresh the cookies especially I usually get either or both cookies or cookies and ice cream it's worth the trip from the other side of town for these fresh tasty cookies and ice cream cookie sandwiches!!!
author: Rolin S.

description:
Hit this place up yesterday in North Beach... A M A Z I N G!!! The owner was so sweet and helpful. She served us and seemed to have such a joy for her work and business. Was refreshing to see. 
I had the coffee Ice Cream with the oatmeal cookie and choc chip... was soooo good. The owner mentioned her fav combo... and that she eats it every other day for lunch:) Will def be going back for more.
author: Mark M.

description: I had really high hopes for this place but was disappointed last night. The cookies were hard and the ice cream was good at best. We asked for It to be heated up and it was not. Good concept bad execution.
author: Billy Alyssa S.

description:
Emma is an absolute sweetheart. I would give her 10 stars!!! Everyone should come here for the delicious and unique, customizable ice cream creations. The bear batter (blue cake batter + brownies + fudge is highly recommended and amazing. Show Emma some love! She will give you 110% hospitality and nothing less. 

It was an unforgettable experience and will draw me back every time I'm in SF. A true gem!

Thanks for putting a smile on our faces!!!
author: Kenneth L.

description: I had the soy chocolate chip on a chocolate chip and macadamia cookie with sliced almonds. Just your average ice cream sandwich. Customer service is not the best. Was not greeted nor saw any smiles from employees.
author: Érica M.

description: My kids LOVED this place. Our first desert in America! All my kids could say os why isnt this in Australia. Great deserts and good value.
author: Adam J.

description: Simply awesome. And incredibly nice staff! We had crazy kids with crazy orders and they never got agitated and consistently served us with a smile. Great place!
author: Neetu P.

description:
I got the donut sandwich with strawberry cheesecake as my ice cream and caramel as my topping. It was very good. The donut was so moist and soft and the ice cream was absolutely delicious. Overall the donut sandwich was pleasing to not only my taste buds, but also to my eyes.

I came here on a Saturday and it was very difficult to look for parking. There are plenty of stores and restaurants in the neighborhood so there are always people taking up parking spots. I recommend going to parking garage nearby. Look closely at the price because each parking garage has its own price.
author: Kristie N.

description: So yummy!! If you're in the area you should definitely check it out. There are a ton of choices for toppings, cookie flavor, ice cream flavor.
author: Madisyn A.

description: OMG this place for being so small was so good.They have home made cookies .I had a hot fudge Sunday and my husband had cookie ice cream sandwich. MMM
author: Laura G.
