description: Omg I don't even know where to begin...this place puts CREAM to shame. Sorry but cream went way downhill with their quality which opted me to try this place out. Baked Bear has their own fresh cookies, donuts, ice cream, that all melts in your mouth! Favorite ice cream is the bear batter... you have to get it! Also, the donuts are always so soft with the ice cream they don't freeze or harden. Wish I could eat their ice cream as much as I think about it :/ definitely a sweet treat I must indulge in every few months :)
author: Carissa G.

description: Don't be deterred by the line! This place is totally worth the wait. The donut sandwich is life changing. ALWAYS get the blue glaze on anything you get. Went two days in a row and am thankful I don't live near one or else I would come everyday. If you are in San Francisco, definitely stop here for some amazing dessert.
author: Lucy C.

description:
When I saw the wonderful reviews at this place, I totally wanted to love it. I love ice cream sandwiches, but I think I've been spoiled by being able to make my own ice cream, cookies, and brownies. Since the boy and I were sharing, I decided we would go with the combo - cookie, brownie and ice cream. I decided on the s'more cookie and the cookies and cream ice cream. Since there was an option to get it hot pressed, we decided to go with that as well. 

When I was finally able to order, after waiting for a while (a lot longer than expected with the number of people in line), it was beautifully presented to us. I thought the brownie and the cookie would be nicely warm with slightly melted ice cream to make it into a somewhat sundae type dessert...and that's definitely not what I got. The brownie and cookies were lukewarm at best. The ice cream was super hard as well so it made the entire thing kind of hard to eat. 

Overall, it was an a-ok experience and not something as amazing as I thought it was going to be. 

Protip: definitely go with the combo. Best of both brownie and cookie worlds.
author: Nina Y.

description: Baked Bear is a hidden gem in North Beach. My sisters and mom came to visit me in SF and searched high and low for the ultimate sweet creation. Ema (the owner) is a peach. She was so patient and kind while we designed our creations. There are so many options! She smiled the whole time while giggle and mixed and matched cookies, brownies, and ice creams. Any sandwhich can also be pressed and warmed for maximum ooey gooey yumminess. My mom and Ema chatted for a while and she even sent us home with some delicious cookies. She really is such a sweetheart. Happy to support a local business like this. Everyone should stop in!
author: Alexandria K.

description:
While the name of this awesome place sounds like someone from the Castro went to the Haight and had a good time, this place in its entirety is no joke!

From the freshness, selection, and different combinations of their ice creams, cookies, and toppings they all offer here, you'll be overwhelmed contemplating what you'll want to get when you first approach their menu panel!

Just off to the side of crowded Jefferson St. in the Wharf, we were on the hunt to finally find this place on a beautiful sunny afternoon, and luckily it wasn't crowded at all! When we got there, there were plenty of outdoor seating and families just having a fun time admiring how massive their sandwiches were! 

I ended up wanting their Salted Caramel Fuge ice cream with their Red Velvet Cookie while my friend wanted their Bear Batter on a brownie. They were both out of those flavors however, so we settled on Birthday Cake, which was kind of a bummer, but understandable since we came late and they're pretty popular. Lesson learned!

Overall, their service was great and the affordable sandwiches take no time to make, but be prepared to grab some napkins and utensils if you have to! Perfect for strolling through the Wharf with, or just hanging around in their outdoor seating! :)
author: Kyrie S.

description: I took my kids here on our last night in the city.   These were so yummy!!!!   Definitely a must for your sweet tooth!
author: Shannon R.

description:
OMG... Becky, look at that ice cream.  It's so big.  It looks like killer ice cream with baked good....

Lol- just go.
author: Deano G.

description: Heard about this through a friend and I was more than tempted to go because of the pretty foods. Walked in on a Monday afternoon with a friend, and it wasn't packed. Score! After looking at all the combinations of ice cream sandwich (doughnut^2, doughnut + cookie, cookie + brownie...) I settled (okay it was a really hard choice) on a doughnut sandwich with birthday cake flavored ice cream, and fruity pebbles. It was definitely a cheat day but sooooo worth it. The doughnut was doughy and gooey and the ice cream was perfect. I had to eat it with a spoon because of how big it was. Overall, a fantastic experience and a perfect afternoon treat.
author: Rutuja R.

description:
Brownie 
+ cookie 
+ ice cream 
+ San Francisco 
+ Heath bar 
+ hot fudge 
+ ample outdoor seating 
+ affordable 
_______________________________
Mary is in heaven 

Seriously, get over there and try this shiz. Unlike any concept I've ever seen! But I am a Midwest gal, so all you west coasters probably are just on to something..
author: Mary G.

description: Loved the ice cream over the warm chocolate chip cookie base. Fantastic concept and well executed. This is great if you're craving something sweet as a snack or dessert!
author: Sana H.

description: Not entirely sure what all the hype is about.. the line was long and slow, the ice cream was extremely sweet and the cookies weren't even served warm after they were "heated". Tried to get the bear bowl with cookies and they said they don't have any.. but cookies were everywhere. They said I could do half brownie and half cookie which made it some other combo they had. If I had the ingredients I sure wouldn't tell a customer no especially after waiting in the cold in a long line. Those are the customers that keep you in business. Would I go back? Probably if the line wasn't long and I was craving cheap sweets, but I wouldn't go out of my way especially if I passed a Crepe place along the way.
author: Marco R.

description: Truly amazing dessert spot!  Loved the donut, loved the ice cream, loved the cookies.  I sampled a few flavors before committing (ice cream is like dating lol), but the owner didn't mind at all.  To the contrary, she encouraged me to try more.  I'm usually all about chocolate, but the birthday cake ice cream was extraordinary.  Like, omg ridiculously delicious.  Coffee ice cream gets honorable mention.  Overall, everything was fantastic!  Hope they expand into LA.  :)
author: Jesstine G.

description: I know many people would look over my review however, this place can get too sweet. I love their ice cream, it was really worth it. But being paired with the ice cream makes it really unbearable. My boyfriend who has the biggest sweet tooth is completely in love with this place but I really don't care much for the donut ice cream. I wish the donut was softer and less sweet, it was compliment the ice cream a little more. Maybe even different donut would work with their ice cream. Hopefully, a salted caramel donut with sea salt vanilla ice cream with chocolate chips would be made. Or a strange combo of some sort can be made for people who like a little salty and sweet in their dessert. Overall, it's good. Not my taste in ice cream but well worth it.
author: Ann N.

description: I needed to get a dessert and this happened to be walking distance from my hotel. Yay. This is a truck that opens pretty late. I had the donut ice cream sandwich with mint and oreo. Ive had a donut sandwich before at another place so I was reluctant to try this one but it was actually pretty good. I also got the funfetti cookie and cookies and cream. Why do I do this to myself...It is ok...it was my birthday and I can get fat if I want to haha
author: Amy H.

description: Way better than C.R.E.A.M! (South Bay peeps) Also, there was only one person running both cashier, payments, and creation. And she kept that line non-existent!
author: Romy M.

description: I got a pressed donut ice cream and strawberry cheesecake ice cream it tasted phenomenal:)
author: Trang N.

description:
My daughter said "Delicious Ice Cream! Delicious Cookie" 

Husband said "I must come back for another one" 

I didn't try it, but just the fact that they loved it I will give it a 5star. Father and daughter, both are big ice cream people, and they will try and enjoy anything with ice cream on it. They had the the bear bowl and the doughnut sandwich. Just by the looks of it, it was Delicious!
author: Julie G.

description: This place was incredible!!! After taking in the sites of the city, stopped by for a quick dessert based off reviews and me and my husband were WOWED! The warm moist cookie with the delish ice cream was AMAZEBALLS!!! I had the white chocolate macadamia cookie with the caramel ice cream and am drooling over it as type!
author: Nhu P.

description: Unbelievable!!! A must eat! The cookies were soft and warm and the ice cream was amazing!
author: Kat C.

description: Sweet little thing! I love brownie , I love ice cream , prefect match, especially they warm  up my brownie ice cream sandwich ! Simple five star  for me !!!
author: Yan C.

description:
Fatty's Paradise. I mean, I still see this place in my dreams. I still taste the sweet heavenly goodness on my tongue. I still feel the fat on my ass. I don't even care, either. 

The woman running this little (permanent??) food truck is a gem. She was so sweet and did me up a right diabetic-coma-inducing delicacy. 

What I like most about this place is that you can choose your gluttony off a list of all the things that are good in this life: fresh baked cookies, premium ice cream, and endless sugary toppings. 

I picked Funfetti cookies, cake batter ice cream, and rainbow sprinkles, because I'm a really immature 12-year-old stuck inside the body of an obese woman. #thestruggle

For real though, if you're at Fishermen's Wharf and tired of fish, check the Baked Bear out. You will not regret your decision. That is, unless you care about buttoning your pants.
author: Katie P.

description:
I saw a picture of this amazing donut ice cream sandwich w/ fruity pebbles on it. Once I got to SF I had to find it. There are 2 Baked Bear locations, but this one is close to the water so you can walk along the water and/or check out Fisherman's Wharf. I got exactly what I wanted. I got there right when they first opened so there was a small wait. Warm donut cut in half, w/ vanilla ice cream & fruity pebbles for the win. If you're not a diabetic you may be after having one of these. 
If you're not a fan of my selection they have tons of other options. There is only outside seating. It's a small walk up shop. Imagine going up to a food truck basically. If you're sweet tooth comes a calling, answer the call!
author: Kevin Z.

description: Five stars is well deserved! In addition to the great tasting ice cream and baked goods, the owner was very nice and grateful we visited. I let her know that I found her place on Yelp. The only reason I visited because the pictures on Yelp and the reviews. I ordered the Bear Bowl Brownie with Birthday Cake ice cream and it was awesome. The brownie was moist and had a fudge filled center. It was like butter in that it melted in my mouth. The birthday cake brownie complimented it well. My girl got the chocolate chip cookie sandwich filled with the blue bear ice cream. It was good, too.
author: Juan M.

description:
Baked Bear... where have you been all my life?!

A place where you can customize your own ice cream sandwich!  Heaven!

So many options... you can make a sandwich using cookies, brownies, donuts, or a combination of these.  There are 10+ types of cookies to choose from (chocolate chip, funfetti, snickerdoodles).  There are 10+ types of ice cream to choose from (chocolate, coffee, cookie dough).  There are 10+ toppings to choose from (fruity pebbles, oreo crumbs, caramel).  Check out the menu to get an idea of just how many possibilities there are!

Overwhelmed by the choices, I ended up with a "Bear Bowl".  Essentially, I had a chocolate chip cookie bowl fresh out of the oven with melty chocolate paired with a scoop of cookies-and-cream ice cream topped with hot caramel and whipped cream.  O  M  G.  Sinfully good.  

The woman working the walk-up window was very nice and very helpful.  She complimented every choice I made and really talked up just how good my creation was going to be.  What was delivered did not disappoint by any means.  

Open late!  Check it out if you have an extreme sweet tooth like me!!  Some seating near the business or take it to go.  Decent prices as well!
author: Ashley P.

description: This place has such great reviews that I thought I would love this place. Not sure if I went here at the wrong time or not (around 4 pm on a weekday), but my experience here was terrible. The cookies on my ice cream sandwich tasted old and stale. Even the cookie dough ice cream and the Heath bar toppings didn't taste great. Everything tastes old. I was very disappointed by this place.
author: Raheel K.

description: I was on vacation in San Francisco for a few days. Walking around Fisherman's Wharf making me and my boyfriend crave for some desert. We found this place on yelp so we decided to give it a try. I tried their unique flavor called "bear batter". It taste like vanilla mix with cookies with brownie bites. Personally it's too sweet for me but if you love sweet this will be perfect for you.
author: Ani N.

description:
This is such a cute shop! The woman manning the place is so so friendly. She was very patient while I decided on what I wanted.

I ordered a donut sandwich with birthday cake ice cream and fruity pebbles toppings. It cost around $4-5 which isn't bad for a gourmet donut ice cream sandwich.

Let me tell you, she knows how to make an instagram-able donut ice cream sandwich! I've been to other places that are messy or careless when putting together the sandwich but she made sure this one was pretty. She drizzled some icing on top in a checkered pattern and made the fruit pebbles coat the ice cream perfectly. 

The donut was somewhat warm and the combination was delicious! One other gripe I have about these places is sometimes they use stale cereal but not The Baked Bear! The fruity pebbles added a great crunchy texture to the ice cream. 

I would come back here often if I lived in SF
author: Jillian C.

description: Very hard to go wrong with ice cream sandwiches, but Baked Bear really goes above and beyond. With so many options - (pick brownies, doughnuts, or cookies to sandwich your ice cream!) - there are endless combinations to try. I also really appreciate that cookie samples are offered to help you decide! Also that you can put toppings on the sides of the ice cream, I'm literally drooling thinking about it right now.
author: Christine Y.

description:
You NEED to try this place out! It is awesome!! If you love cookies and ice cream, this is the place is for you. We had chocolate chip cookies with sea salt caramel fudge with brownie bits topping. They even warm up the cookies for you. Yummmm!!! 

The place is small and is located in the Fisherman Wharf, across from the Walgreens by the Holiday Inns. It's easy to miss, but, you can't beat this! It is just sinfully good.
author: Daisy S.

description:
Cute outdoor food truck type stand in the wharf. You can select which cookies you'd like to sandwich your preference of ice cream flavor between. Toppings are at an additional charge. Around $5 each if you don't overdo the toppings. I had a sweet combo w/ birthday cake ice cream paired w/ funfetti and cookies & cream cookies that I added fruity pebbles to. The cereal gave it a nice crunch and it was fresh, not stale like some specialty donut places. 

Incredibly friendly staff. The lady who made our order was very nice and sweet.
author: Julie L.

description: YUMMMMMM! Love the variety of options they have to make your own ice cream sandwich! We decided to not get too creative so we had what we've named the "Breakfast Sandwich" - Oatmeal Cinnamon Cookie with Coffee Ice Cream Sandwich. It was delicious!
author: Nicole S.

description: Nothing homemade ice cream or cookie wise. You could literally go to walmart and buy the premade cookie dough and great value ice cream and make what they did. Cost nearly 8 dollars for a tiny not homemade cookie and regular ice cream in a foil bowl. Tasted exactly like it too. Nothing special unfortunately. The lady running the shop was friendly and quick which was one of the redeeming things about this place. The fact you have plenty of options is also nice but like I previously stated it isn't anything special or homemade.
author: Alex S.

description:
Overall:  4.4/5
------------

FOOD:  4.5/5
1) Chocolate Chip Cookie Sandwich (vanilla ice cream)
Note: What makes this place different from other places is that the cookies are freshly made and warmed to go with the ice cream sandwich. The vanilla ice cream is likewise outstanding on its own. Must try buy messy to eat, next time i will get a scoop with a warm cookie on the side

SERVICE:  4/5

CLEANLINESS:  3.5/5

LOCATION:  5/5

EXPERIENCE:  5/5

-------------------
Wait time: 0 mins (weekend, afternoon)
author: John V.

description:
Very good ice-cream sandwiches ! 

I did not expected such a heavy "sandwich", the toppings are numerous and the people really welcoming.

Maybe a bit expensive but the quality is definitely present !
author: Michele B.

description: Wow. True to the reviews. This place was amazing. And it's so hot today that it was doubly awesome. We really enjoyed the salted caramel ice cream and snickerdoodle cookies. My mom got a root beer float which was basic but exactly what she wanted. And shout out to the Caramel Pizza Company next door for letting us drink a beer while the kids ate their ice cream. Such a perfect way to end our day at the air show.
author: Megan M.

description: Walking around the SF Wharf getting you tired and ready for a cool sweet treat?  Head on over to the Baked Bear for yummy custom ice cream sandwiches!  I got a "combo" (chocolate chip cookie and a brownie)...and got vanilla ice cream and rainbow sprinkles!  It was yummy!  Both the cookie and the brownie were moist & chewy but strong enough to hold up to the thick ice cream. Make sure to get napkins, though.
author: Mitzi A.

description:
I went on the 2nd Day of Opening and I got the Bear Batter ice cream with White Chocolate Macademia and Cookies and Cream Cookies with Chocolate Chips! It was by far one of my favorite Ice Cream Sandwiches ever.

Staff was friendly, attentive, and it was 4.29 for the whole thing! Amazing experience here!
author: Matt D.

description: Only thing to really say about this is it was so so good! That's sort of all you need to know.  Just go there, try it, indulge!  I did a lot of walking on my trip to SF and this was a well deserved treat!
author: Dawn B.

description: Home made ice cream and fresh baked cookies to customize into ice cream cookies. Very delicious and I wished I had the belly space to eat more!!
author: Jenni Y.

description: A must go! The cookies were warm and soft but still held their shape, as all good cookies in an ice cream sandwich should. The ice cream was rich and creamy and had lots of cookie chunks (I had cookies and cream inside the sandwich). It was so good, I wanted to get another one and was bummed that I didn't have any room left in my stomach.
author: Joseph A.

description: One of my all time favourite places to go on a cheat day!! Their ice cream creations are incredible. So much selection! Highly recommend the Bear Batter ice cream (blue colour), their cookies are fantastic. I also got a brownie but i think it would have been better if they warmed it up. So if you do get a brownie sandwich ask for it to be warmed up! So delicious, will definitely be back again soon!
author: Ghazal S.

description:
As my trip to San Francisco was one of my first real vacations, I did a few things wrong: I booked through a third party travel company and ended up with a middle seat away from my girlfriend on the plane; I booked a motel room on the first floor near the street; my biggest regret on this trip, however, was splitting a baked bear ice cream sandwich with my girlfriend. It was so incredibly delicious and gone way too fast.
 
We opted for the "combo sandwich" (a brownie on the bottom and a chocolate chip cookie on top; $4.25) and cookie dough ice cream with hot fudge on top. It blew me away with how delicious it was. I would, however, suggest saving 50 cents and not adding the hot fudge to your sandwich as the hot fudge was actually just chocolate syrup and didn't add much to the dish.

As well as having amazing ice cream, I also really liked Baked Bear because of the amazingly kind staff. When I later (slightly embarrassingly) returned to get the second half of the ice cream sandwich that I desired so badly (one cookies n cream ice cream scoop and one cookies n cream cookie), she only charged for the scoop of ice cream. 

I highly recommend going to Baked Bear if you are in the San Fran area!
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Came here today right at 2pm for their grand opening, and found myself about 20th in line. Within 15-20 minutes we were up next, and service was prompt, friendly, and courteous. I thought they did a great job at running things as efficiently as possible during this busy Saturday afternoon grand opening. It got pretty crowded pretty fast, as the line grew to almost a block long. Line still moved quickly, and their famous bear came out to keep the kids entertained. From what I could see, everyone was having a great time. 

I ordered the strawberry cheesecake cookie with chocolate chip cookie, coffee ice cream, and fruity pebbles. I definitely wasn't disappointed! I kinda wanted to stand in line again! Can't wait to go back. My only wish is for more creative flavors and variety of cookies and ice cream. 

FYI I thought prices weren't too bad. Serving size is decent. I imagine this would be a great place to take the family and kids for ice cream and enjoy a nice sunny day at Fisherman's Warf.
author: Lizzie L.

description: OMG - if you go to San Francisco do yourself a huge favor and eat at this place!  I got funfetti cookies, birthday cake ice cream and sprinkles.  PERFECT.  The sweet lady behind the counter was wonderful.  The cookies and ice cream were to die for.  Soooooooooo good!  She gave us a free cookie on the way out too.  Great place!!!!
author: Susan M.

description: The ice cream and the cookies are ok. It may be that they were all out of most of their flavors by the end of the day when I visited.
author: Sonia M.

description:
Good stuff!!!
Owner was very nice and gave us multiple cookie samples prior to ordering.  Cookies were fresh and tasty. Ice cream portion was generous and tasteful.  Nice to be able to customize so many options to your own desire. Great little diamond in a rough near fishermans wharf.
author: Jeff H.

description: This place is out of control. So many options to make your perfect dessert. I had to go with brownie on bottom, mint chip ice cream, chocolate chip cookie in too and topped it with fudge. Definitely a spot to check out when you're looking for the ultimate sugar fix. There was a line out the door but it went quick!
author: Kathryn G.

description: Cookie and brownie tag team cookie's and cream ice cream. Enough said, it was delicious.
author: Nate B.

description: Such great Ice Cream, I wanted to come here mainly because there was a Vegan option for my girlfriend. Although it really is just ONE option, she did enjoy it a lot and that's all that mattered. I had the regular ol Cookies n Cream, and she got the Soy Chocolate Chip. Totally Recommend!
author: Manuel E.

description: The cookie icecream is definitely photogenic - esp the blue color cookie dough one. Definitely recommend the red velvet cookie! Service was great too!
author: Abigail S.

description: Loved the ice cream and toppings. I wish the donuts were warm though.  I'll order again from here!
author: Andrea V.

description: My wife found this place and we tried it and it was delicious.  The Lady Was So Nice And Gave US Samples and helped us decided on what to order
author: Jesus A.

description: $8 for a cookie sandwich but darn good. Flavors are unique and on point. The toppings to put around the sandwich are the cherry on top.
author: Sean M.

description:
The cookies and cream ice cream is my favorite. Not too sweet. The caramel fudge ice cream is sweeter but also very good. 

Chocolate chip cookies are great.
author: Sam B.

description: super yummy! I love that you can customize your own sandwich. They have really fun flavors and toppings! You can also cater through them which they do a fantastic job with!
author: Makenzi B.

description: The concept of this ice cream shop is unique. It's good that you get to customize your ice cream sandwich. You may choose brownies, cookies or donuts. You may also add toppings. But in my opinion, the ice cream is too sweet.
author: Leanna C.

description: Great outdoor environment. Ice cream sandwiches are made to order with fresh cakes cookies. Bear batter ice was really good.
author: Mike C.

description:
The Baked Bear is such a cute little place! We stopped here while on vacation and thought it was a really unique idea. Basically, any combination of cookies, brownies, or donuts with ice cream is possible here. The owner is also so sweet and made me a combination topping of caramel and chocolate when I couldn't decide which one I wanted. :) 

Definitely a great place to curb your sweet tooth!
author: Sara N.

description: So good.  Found it hard to eat the big cookie sandwich but who cares? It's ice cream!
author: Steve D.

description: Very cool set up! Friendly vibe with an easy to read menu. The staff was helpful and patient with us for our first time. The dessert itself was top of the line. I ordered a cookie dough ice cream donut sandwich topped with fruity pebbles. TIP: ORDER A COOKIE AND INSERT IT INSIDE YOUR SANDWICH. Thank me later !
author: Zach S.

description:
All I can say is that I will definitely be coming back! There are so many options and combinations to choose from, which will satisfy craving. It's sweet treat to end your day or during a hot summer day. I opted for the chocolate chip cookies with birthday cake ice cream and sprinkles. 
Not only was my cookie sandwich amazing, the service was exceptional as well.
author: Haley B.

description: I've heard great things about Baked Bear but sadly, my expectations fell short. I got a donut sandwich with bear batter ice cream and fruity pebbles topping. The donut was a bit dry and tasted like something you could get at Safeway. The ice cream itself was good, but a bit too sweet. Paired together with an icing drizzle, the dessert was unBEARably sweet (ba dum tss).
author: Sharon I.

description: Pretty tasty! Super fresh funfetti cookies and creamy salted caramel ice cream drizzled with plenty of hot fudge made for a perfect evening stop in North Beach. I was a tiny bit disappointed by the brownie chunks which were kind of hard and not as fudge brownie-ish as I was anticipating. Other than that, I have no complaints. And you can't beat the price!
author: Laurel M.

description: Best ice cream.  Beats bi rite on taste.  Maybe the selection is not as extensive,  but the taste is definitely worth a visit.
author: Evelyn S.

description:
A cookie-ice cream sandwich is one of those things that makes you think, "Why didn't I think of that?" Because it's delicious and that's exactly what the Baked Bear dishes up. The featured s'mores cookie, hot pressed, with mocha ice cream in the middle was golden. 
Bring your culinary creativity and create some combinations. You won't be disappointed.
author: Karl C.

description: These ice cream desserts are delicious! Similar to "Cream", but in my opinion, better. Bring bottled water to drink if you're the type that needs a drink to wash down the sweetness. The prices start around $5.95 I believe. $0.50 for each topping. Pricey but affordable. It's not a shop, but an ice cream truck. They have a small seating section. It gets busy, and the workers aren't fast, but it's worth the wait. Cash and cards accepted.
author: Cici Y.

description:
Found this new spot on Yelp, and so lucky we did. Simple menu (build your own ice cream sandwich) and great service. The baked goods are fantastic (cookies, brownies and donuts) and they're paired nicely with a perfect sized serving of ice cream. Can also get a waffle cone or a sundae...basically same ingredients served your favorite way. 

It's a food bodega/truck with an outside seating area (about 10 seats), but this yumminess is also good for walking and a stroll of the Wharf area. 

Got a chance to meet the owner (Emma) who's busy in the kitchen and tending to customers. Clear to see that she takes pride in her business and making her customers happy. We will be back!
author: Shannon E.

description: I ordered the chocolate chips cookies with Vanilla ice cream sandwich.  The cookie was soft, moist, and delicious. The ice cream was good and creamy.  It is definitely a great spot and good location
author: Jess T.

description:
Best place ever!

I've been wanting to go to this place ever since I discovered it on Yelp, and I finally got a chance to go yesterday. I ordered a donut sandwich with a scoop of birthday cake ice cream, rolled in fruity pebbles.

It was amazing. The birthday cake ice cream had the perfect texture and the donut was warmed. It was a little messy to eat, but it was worth the sticky fingers.

Service is wonderful, the owner lady was very sweet and accommodating. Happy smiles all around.

Okay now I want another one now. :(
author: Lea L.

description: Ice cream is very delicious, we love the place, it is very nice.
author: Mega Team R.

description: So so good! You can create whatever kind of ice cream sandwich. One was big enough for both of us to share. Decent pricing
author: Kristen T.

description: The area is really adorable and cute to go with friends. However, I believe it is overrated and it was not really what I expected. It is basically like CREAM however, there are more toppings, cookie choices and dessert choices to choose from. Although, I do like how you can substitute the cookie with a Donut or Brownie. I like how the ice cream flavors are not just the basic vanilla or chocolate but there is for example, the Baked Bear flavor where it is blue and has brownie bits.Other unique flavors are the salted caramel, birthday cake, those were the 2 that caught my eye. I was hoping that when they heated up the cookie, it was gonna be warm but it was not. Everything else was decent as far as seating, price, and choices to choose from.
author: Stacey M.

description: there are so many customizations here that it's a perfect place to statisfy your sweet tooth!
author: Sarina A.

description: This place is amazing! Not only is the ice cream delicious, the customer service is top notch. I once received the wrong topping on my customized ice cream sandwich, and an employee immediately offered to fix it to my preference and gave us a 10% discount. I'd definitely go again and recommend to a friend.
author: Abrefi A.

description: Super yummy took my daughter here for her first baked bear she loved it made especially for her the staff is awesome n friendly love this place
author: Dean D.

description: Poor girl was working her tail off and they were out of a lot of cookies,  but since it was just before  closing it was understandable.  The flavors were full,  and we loved having so many options.  The ice cream was yummy too.
author: Maxine K.

description:
A very cool place in the busy fisherman's wharf. I would give them a five star if they weren't sold out of the gluten free cookies. But the ice cream was super tasty and the fact that they usually do have gluten free cookies cheered me up! :)
And also the price is so affordable and realistic!
author: Shelly S.

description: This is like Diddy Riese in L.A., it was so good!  I was visiting town and I saw this place by the pier. The cookies are so fresh and delicious! The ice cream is also so good.  Perfect combo, priced fair. Emma (or maybe Eva) was very nice and warm. I would definitely recommend, love this place. - Olivia
author: Jillian V.

description: The best ice cream, best donuts, best toppings, and best owner!! Everything is made with love. This place is a gem!!!
author: Sarah E.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here a while ago after dinner (I don't remember what we got) and I believe the owner helped us out and was so kind, I couldn't help but smile because everything was just perfect. The service, the ice cream sandwich was omg good, and there are so many different options you can choose from it's hard to pick one. 
This is definitely an amazing place everyone should try at least once.
author: Bridget O.

description: This place is heaven! The cookie bottom was great, the doughnut top was great and the vanilla ice cream center with sprinkles and fruity pebbles was amazing. Get an ice cream Sammie and you won't be disappointed. The only downside was the strawberry ice cream my wife got was not good. It had a fake strawberry taste. Would definitely try again!
author: Paul L.

description: Suuuuper long line on a Friday night, Pre-Valentine's Day celebration. One girl working totally alone. We Felt so bad for her. Desserts are great, but don't come unless you're prepared to spend 25+ mins in line.
author: Melinda D.

description: This is heaven on Earth! No joke. This place is absolutely amazing. So many options for a build-your-own ice cream sandwich. You can mix and match whatever you want! ALSO, amazing customer service! The lady here is soooo nice. We couldn't decide which cookie/brownie combo we wanted so she let us try a bunch of fresh-baked cookies! I ended up going with her recommendation of snickerdoodle and brownie. I got birthday cake ice cream and sprinkles on the outside. Absolutely amazing. All around awesome experience. Great dessert, great customer service, great price.
author: Julia M.

description: The woman who served our order was very kind, great service. My kids loved that they got to customize their ice cream sandwiches! And the music was lovely. Great that you are able to mix and match all the cookies
author: A J.

description:
Ermahgerrrrrrd, these ice cream sandwiches are amazing!  And lucky for my husband, who had never tasted an ice cream sandwich before (silly Brits - he was literally picturing spreading ice cream on bread), and this was his first ever example of the treat.  Or is he unlucky since he'll never have such a great ice cream sandwich again?

This location has a few outdoor tables by Fisherman's Wharf, it's basically a food truck.  They have a great mix-n-match menu where you can create a custom ice cream sandwich that will top anything you can buy wrapped in plastic somewhere!  We went with one cookie of the month (it was full of things like little m+ms and other candies) and one white chocolate macadamia cookie, and cookie dough ice cream, and the ice cream was topped with mini M+Ms.  We got it slightly warmed, which was actually amazing because somehow the ice cream didn't melt everywhere (maybe because we ate it so fast?) but the cookies were softer and just had a hint of warmth about them.

It was so delicious.  Just so good.  The cookies absolutely had a homemade, fresh-baked quality about them.  The sandwich didn't fall apart at all, somehow, and it was only about $4 for a crazy-awesome dessert that we split between two of us since we were stuffed from pizza, but normal people should get one each because sharing something this yummy will make you sad.  It's cold here in England and yet if I had one of these in front of me right now I would devour it in a second!
author: Meredith A.

description: Amazing dessert. Fresh cookies topped with delicious ice-cream. We had the Bear Bowl version as it was less messy to eat. The salted caramel fudge ice cream was delicious.
author: Dejan S.

description: I LOVED IT !! I got the cookie bear bowl and my friend got the cookie sandwich. I got half salted Carmel fudge with fudge drizzle. And it was so good ! The lady at the counter was SO helpful and nice literally made my experience great. It's a great place if you want to treat you're self with some ice cream and in the mood for something sweet. Hospitality was A1 !!!
author: Cynthia R.

description:
Im a visitor from Chicago and my sister was raving about this place so we went and were not disappointed. The owner is such a sweetheart and was very welcoming and was so nice to us. 

I got the cookie sandwich with red velvet cookies, birthday cake ice cream rolled in Heath bar bits. So deliciously sweet and satisfying. Your kids will love it, you will love it, definitely a spot if you have a sweet tooth. You can customize your cookie sandwich which is awesome for picky kids, or those who like variety. 

Check this place out!
author: Dan R.

description: I'm such a sweet tooth, I knew I had to check this place out while on vacation. The location is just a small trailer along the sidewalk with a couple of tables set up. The service was a little slow for only having one couple in line ahead of us, but it looked like there was just one gal working taking both the orders and then making the sandwiches. I had the cookie sandwich with a funfetti cookie and a lemon bar cookie (which was a seasonal flavor) with just vanilla ice cream and sprinkles and whipped cream. The funfetti cookie was soft and chewy, but the lemon bar cookie was hard so it made the sandwich hard to eat in any way. I kind of have regrets about not trying to donut sandwich instead, but on another visit it will have to happen!
author: jessica c.

description: Thanks to Instagram I found this gem! I had the glazed donut ice cream sandwich with cookie dough ice cream and Oreo crumbles. Also it was topped with warm glaze. I also got it hot pressed which is highly recommended! Not giving it 5 stars because each part by itself was not 5 stars worthy (not the best donut or ice cream I've had) just great in combination!
author: Katherine A.

description: I wasn't a fan of the cookies here. The taste of them were not that great and had a very doughy taste that I can't really describe. The ice cream flavors were pretty standard for the foodie world today.
author: Lisa H.

description: Loved this place! A delicious twist to the ice cream sandwich with the donut option. I went on a Saturday and there was plenty people enjoying themselves here, and taking pictures of their ice cream! I got cookies and cream on a donut, It was amazing, I wish I had one right now! My boyfriend got a brownie ice cream sandwich, looked good too! Definitely worth trying!
author: Evelyn D.

description: This place is definitely a must when visiting San Francisco.  Ordered a donut sandwich with cookies and cream ice cream.  Not big on ice cream but it was creamy and delicious. The combination with a donut was genius! We were craving another one by the end of the night. Thumbs up!
author: Carolyn H.

description: I found heaven!  Doughnut ice cream sandwich? Yes please!!! The glazed doughnut with strawberry ice cream is the perfect balance. The doughtnut is not so doughy. Perfect ratio of ice cream to dough.  Melts in your mouth!
author: D D.

description: I stumbled upon this great little dessert food truck during my trip to San Francisco. I had a hard time picking a combination of cookie and ice cream because I wanted them all. After much contemplating, I decided to go with the brownie sandwich. Let me tell you, it was the best decision I've ever made in my life!! It was warm and gooey... so delicious with the ice cream!! Must try if you ever get the chance!
author: Kimberly L.

description: Little bit of a wait but absolutely worth it. I enjoy trying new things and since we were on vacation this place was worth a shot. We all enjoyed it!
author: Tina R.

description: Taste great. On the expensive side but definitely the best ice cream sandwich I had. Cookies and brownies are soft and chewy. Ice cream is fresh and not sugary sweet.
author: Andrew W.

description: The chocolate chip cookie itself was bomb. The vanilla ice cream was creamy and sweet and delicious. The almonds gave it anextra crunch. Simple sandwich but crazy good. Total $5.45
author: Denise U.

description: This place is heaven on earth! Where have they been all my life? From the fresh cookies to the flavorful ice cream to the friendly staff, this place is incredible. Create your own ice cream sandwich...yes please! Made a brownie ice cream sandwich with mint chocolate chip ice cream and hot fudge drizzled on top! It was ridiculously yummy! The manager is also the nicest, sweetest lady! Loves her customers; you can tell!
author: Jason T.

description: This place is AMAZING! I have had it in San Diego and so happy it has made its way up to the Bay! Its even better than I remembered, i got funfetti cookies with birthday cake ice cream and it was so delicious, my husband loved his too! Emma helped us and she was so sweet and kind! A perfect treat while your out at Fishermans Wharf!
author: JoAnna S.

description:
I've walked past this place a few times and finally got to experience the sweet wonders that Emma (owner) had given us. 
We were greeted as soon as we walked in and stared in awe at the menu. A donut ice cream sandwich? Brownies? Cookies? And you can mix and match? Sold to the woman who has a sweet tooth. Though there aren't a lot of choices (compared to some places), I still found myself unable to choose. Emma quickly offered samples. Not a big deal, right?
That is until we were given the sample of the strawberry cheesecake cookie. It was a whole cookie that she split in half for my boyfriend and I to try. Those cookies aren't too small either! 
After choosing (donut with coffee ice cream and fruity pebbles) we were able to talk to Emma more and her daughter-in-law. Both were sweet and pleasant with amazing hospitality. It was like talking to old friends while indulging in delicious treats. I can go on about the smoothness of the ice cream, how the donut held the ice cream beautifully and the array of toppings, but my tummy is filled with the yummy goodness.
I highly recommend this place.
author: Baillie N.

description:
Here I am thinking about how I'm going to get back in shape after I'm done with school until I find out that there's a Baked Bear in SF!!  First had their ice cream sandwich in SD and came back to SF trying to find an equal with no luck!  Cream..gross!  Over the moon..meh!  Not sure why it took me 4 months to find out Baked Bear opened up here, but so so happy I finally did!  Like I probably said in my review for their store in SD, their ice cream and cookies can stand alone, which is awesome!  There are plenty of different ice cream, cookie, and topping options.  You can even get brownies and doughnuts!

PS: go after 7pm when metered parking is free in the area and layer up bc the seating is outside, but so worth it!!
author: Michelle K.

description: I went there late last night. It was not crowded. I had a custom ice cream sandwich. It  was beautiful,tasty, not expensive and quick. The only downside to the baked bear  is that parking can be difficult. This is a very good place for late night ice cream.
author: Bruce K.

description: Get  1/2 cookie and  1/2 brownie combo and your favorite flavor  super friendly staff.
author: Tara C.

description: Owner was so sweet and so was the delicious cookie sandwich she made us! Cute little place near the water!
author: Jaclyn W.

description: This place is amazing. The cookies and brownies are so good. I got the combo sandwich with one brownie and one chocolate chip cookie with vanilla ice cream and sprinkles. It was sooooo yummy.
author: Caroline L.

description: Feast your eyes on my warm donut with birthday cake ice cream and fruity pebbles from The Baked Bear! Tonight I had the pleasure of treating myself to this concoction! OMG! This is absolutely a must try if you're in the area visiting and need a sweet treat.
author: Kim K.

description: I have been reading so many reviews to check this place out since it suppose to be the best but maybe it just me who was a bit disappointed by how great ice cream donut sandwich would taste. I ordered mint ice cream and plain donut but I didn't think these two mixed well. I felt like it was too sweet for me and wished I had ordered just the mint ice cream. The donut was over kill.
author: Brenda M.

description:
Ate here on 10/18.

Walked by this place on the way to dinner and decided this was a must try for dessert.

I had the perfect dessert breakfast, a Glazed Donut Coffee ice cream sanwich.  

The only problem with this place is that there are almost too many combinations.  A definite must stop the next time I am back San Francisco.
author: Scott M.

description: This place was SO adorable! I expected it to be a building but it's actually a truck with a little seating area outside of it. The menu is awesome, you can get different kinds of cookie with different toppings & flavors of ice cream. I think our sandwhich was 5 bucks & it was seriously delicious. Just what we wanted after a late dinner, also cute place for an Instagram pic ;)
author: Cara N.

description: This was the best ice cream place I've ever been to! The idea of ice cream sandwiches with various cookies and brownies and donuts is so cute and delicious. I had a chocolate chip cookie with brownie with chocolate chip cookie dough ice cream in the middle. I loved it!!! I would come back every day if I could!
author: Madeleine K.

description: Totally in love with this place! I just went today for the first time and I was served quickly and kindly. Also, the cookie sandwich was AMAZING. I got a white chocolate macadamia and funfetti cookie, cookie dough ice cream, and sprinkles. I am stuffed.
author: Casey N.

description: Coming from a dessertaholic like myself it was great! Definitely better than CREAM but would still rather go to Ghirardelli!
author: Andrea E.

description: Super original idea and super great dessert! You have a choice of a variety of cookies, brownies, or doughnuts for the sandwich. Then you have about 6 or 7 flavors of ice cream to choose from and then several toppings. You make a custom ice cream sandwich! Great for when it's hot in San Fran (when is it not?) and dessert!
author: Cara T.

description: My custom cookie sandwich was made with: Peanut Butter Cookies, Salted Caramel Fudge Ice-cream, Heath Toffee Bits & Hot Caramel. The food itself was already fulfilling and indulging but what really made the dish for me was the presentation. And when complimented the woman who made it was genuinely appreciative.
author: Mason C.

description:
This is the best dessert place I have ever been to. I got chocolate chip cookies with cake batter ice cream with sprinkles and it was scrumptious! My friend got snickerdoodle cookie on one side and cookie of the month of the other with caramel ice cream cream in the middle and he loved it! The cookies were fresh and chewy. You HAVE to come here at least once while you're in San Francisco! The prices are reasonable and the ladies working there are super sweet and were very patient when I asked them a multitude of questions. 
*get your ice cream sandwich warmed up!
author: Emma W.

description: Brownie bear bowl and chocolate chip bear bowl is everything.  Sooo good!  The customer service was amazing.  When I come back I'm definitely going to stop here.  They have a wide selection of fun flavors and toppings.
author: Lauri P.

description: Great location, quick service, cookies were amazing and unique ice cream! Deliciousness!
author: Caitlin W.

description: Generous considering they were out of all but one type of cookie, brownies, and spoons. Clearly needs better management.
author: Matt G.

description: Ultimate place for those with a sweet tooth!! At first I ordered the donut sandwich with cookies and cream ice cream, unfortunately should've tried the ice cream first because it didn't have too much flavor and the donut combination didn't help (only reason I gave it a 4).  Went back up and got another one, this time with a funfetti cookie and a red velvet cookie with salted caramel fudge ice cream and it was soooo much better. Great place to have an ice cream sandwich, or even just a cookie or ice cream on its own!
author: Yarah L.

description: We had the combo sandwich with a root-beer float as well. Incredible!! The ladies working inside were so kind and friendly. Only a few tables are available for sitting outside. The menu is extensive and everything looks wonderful. I highly recommend the Baked Bear!!
author: Shelby J.

description: Lord have mercy. Pretty close to too good to be true... I may never look at another ice cream sandwich the same way. The cookies were fresh and delicious the ice cream was perfect and the fruity pebbles!! Why did I never think of that?! Delicious! And so so many options!! If I hadn't had a full lunch I would have gotten the doughnut ice cream sandwich but I opted for the funfetti cookie and the m&m cookie (love that you can mix and match) cake batter icecream and again.. FRUITY PEBBLES.
author: Lauren K.

description: This place is great! It's a food truck but for ice cream. They have freshly baked brownies and cookies and let me tell you, it's good!! The employees are super nice, the young gentleman that was working on Saturday evening was really talkative and friendly, it was nice! If we are ever in San Fran again we will DEFINITELY be coming back!!
author: Dee B.

description: Soft cookies, yummy ice cream, insta-worthy toppings. This place is a winner :)
author: Harmeet K.

description: This place is absolutely delicious!! Fresh baked cookies and homemade ice cream. What more can you ask for? Its really affordable given they're located in the tourist part of town. If you're down at fisherman's wharf I suggest you give this place a try. The red velvet cookie and fun fetti are super yummy.
author: Marchelli H.

description: Amazing ice cream sandwiches. You can customize your sandwich and add a topping. The owner is very nice and excellent customer service. She even put our ice cream in to go containers. I would recommend to everyone!
author: Eva P.

description: Ohhh my gosh! This place is awesome. The owner is the sweetiest and most friendly person ever. She made my day just by being sweet and all smiles. The cookies were sooo good. The hot chocolate float was off the hook!! The ice cream must be good as my husband hasn't paused eating it to asnwer me. We left that place with a few extra pounds but a little happier!!
author: Renata L.

description: Heavenly  Came here twice during my SF weekend visit. Ordered a brownie bear bowl with day 1-cookie n' cream and day 2-cookie dough topped with hot fudge and fruity pebbles. It was the perfect sized dessert to share with my bf after lunch. Reasonably priced and Instagram worthy! Seating can be sparse during peak hours tho
author: Jane M.

description:
I tried the chocolate chip bear bowl with mint chip and butter pecan ice cream. Loved it. The cookie was warm and soft and the ice cream was very rich and creamy. Definitely home made.

Customer service was great!
author: Adam F.

description: Saw this ice cream spot while walking by fishermans wharf and HAD TO TRY...amazing ! My husband and I made our own ice cream sandwiches -- he had 2 chocolate chip cookies with cookies and cream ice cream and brownie crumbles on the outside heated up! I had one red velvet cookie and one cinnamon oatmeal cookie with coffee ice cream. Topped with sprinkles and hot caramel sauce ! MUST go!!
author: Josephine L.

description: Had the snicker doodle cookie with salted Carmel fudge ice cream.  Excellent service was terrific and very friendly.
author: Dan M.

description: This place was surreal. We walked by on our way home from chinese food and ice cream sounded good. There was a line with about 8 people so we were on the fence about waiting and decided we would. The wait with 8 people was about 45 minutes. My best guess is that the entire staff was stoned? It seemed like most people were just milling about not doing anything. One worker just kept taking her gloves off and putting them back on. When it came to my turn the girl kind of stared at me blankly when I ordered but finally managed to follow directions by me pointing to what I wanted. The blank stare got worse when she had to enter the order in the computer and I thought making change might just have made her head pop off!
author: Leah S.

description: Emma was awesome! Such good customer service, so kind and friendly! This time we only bought some cookies but they were so good! My fave today was the cookie of the month, a combo of cookies n cream, fingertips and m&m's! Delish!! Her cookies have a little crunch on the edges but more moist in the middle! We will be back!
author: Toni Marie A.

description: Decided to treat ourselves to this place. It was good. We had a brownie ice cream sandwich it was good very overwhelming for one person good idea to share. It was about 6pm and they were sold out of several things mostly cookie choices but we lucked out brownie was still available. Price is reasonable for what you get. Our sandwich was about $6.
author: Vanessa M.

description: This hidden gem is right across from the Walgreens off Jones street. The owner is a doll and such a  pleasure. She offers samples of the cookies to try with a smile. There is a menu with just about every cookie and brownie combo you can think of. Don't miss this spot! Everything was yummy!
author: S B.

description: Delicious and I loved how many different ways you could completely customize your creation. The cookies tasted a little like a cheap Otis Spunkmeyer, but all in all, a yummy treat.
author: Jenna A.

description: I give this place 5 stars no doubt. If you are looking for a great dessert this is the place to go! Also, they have gluten free cookies available which was a must for me! Amazing experience and will go back!
author: Becky A.

description: We went to the one that is in Fisherman's Wharf it was a hard decision since we had a few good choices, but it was very good and filling.
author: Ivonne S.

description: This place is amazing! I love the creations that this place can make! From donut sandwiches with mint chip ice cream and whipped cream, to a classics chocolate chip cookie sandwich with vanilla ice cream rolled in M&Ms, this place has so many combinations! The service is fast, but I'm assuming there can be a long line sometimes. There are two picnic-style tables to sit at, so the only small downside about this place is that there might not be enough seating sometimes.
author: R T.

description: Really awesome place! I am a cookie monster & love their product! Looking forward to come back soon =D Thanks Emma for your smile & your kindness!
author: Myriam J.

description: OH MY GOD! What a brilliant idea! This place was literally so good!! But the reason for 3 stars is that we waited line for 20 MINUTES! There was only one person behind the counter (who was super nice) but it took so long we were about to give up!! If you have loads of time, try this place out!!
author: Lohren M.

description: Great find after a long day touring and dinner out. Cookies and Ice Cream were yummy for the whole family. It is a food truck that is parked, and had to wait for awhile as there was one person in the truck. Worth the wait!
author: Gene T.

description: This ice cream "bar" is something I will suggest to anybody. The ice cream on the inside of my sandwich was amazing as well as the the cookies on the outside. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because I don't cry thinking of how amazing it is.
author: Fisher J.

description: The service is amazing and the product is even more amazing, we got a warmed up brownie Ana funfetti cookie with coffee ice cream and mini chocolate chips!! SO good!!! And fun atmosphere!!
author: Sharon D.

description: great ice cream and cookies. I recommend the cookies and cream cookies. They are really good. The vanilla ice cream is very smooth and tasty
author: Marina S.

description: Ice cream sandwich shop....Yes! Fresh baked cookies was the key to success. With so many cookie/ice cream options my mind was blown. We will be back soon.
author: Thomas R.

description: Best customer services I have ever had in my life! Worker by the name of Emma has taken good care of me and my gf  as soon as the store opened up. Short handed as she was,she still was able to take good care of us and made us feel comfortable. Emma was generous and kind! Thanks to Emma she had made my day!
author: Julius R.

description: This place has 5 stars for a reason. It is WHOA. When I first discovered it, I ended up coming back 3 times that week. Every cookie I tried was incredible. The oatmeal were my favorite, I think. Cookie of the month was cinnamon roll and it was incredible. It was pretty similar to the snickerdoodle, so don't feel bad if you missed out. The ice cream is also delicious. I tried nearly every flavor except coffee - they were out every time I went. You can't go wrong with this place. It's so good.
author: Anne A.

description: Everything I love sugar, soft cookies, and ice cream. Creating your own ice cream sandwich is trouble of the best kind! Extremely liberal scoops. If you have a sweet tooth go here!
author: Joey G.

description: I can count on one hand the number of times I have been to Fishermans Wharf. I happened to be near the Baked Bear when some friends and I were in North Beach and searching for something sweet. The cookies and ice cream were ok but really why I like this place is the super nice lady there. She gave us samples of everything and some good recommendations. On top of that she had a facetime chat with us and her nephew?! I didn't get her name but thanks for making our day better!
author: Mike P.

description: Great ice cream sandwiches with super friendly service!  The fresh baked cookies are excellent!  Highly recommend if you are looking for a tasty treat!
author: Paul B.

description: So I've always wanted to try a donut ice cream sandwich in my life and I heard that Baked Bear served them! But I was pretty disappointed when I bit into my donut sandwich- the "donut" seemed to be somewhat like fried hamburger buns with toaster strudel icing on top. Disappointed that I didn't just get a cookie ice cream sandwich.
author: Mauna T.

description:
This is one of my favorite dessert places in all of San Francisco! You have the choice of cookies and ice cream to make a cookie sandwich. The cookies are baked to perfection and an amazing mix with all the flavors of ice cream.

The prices are extremely reasonable for all that you get. They have an amazing menu and unique product. 

Emma, the owner, is seriously the nicest lady on the face of the Earth! I highly recommend stopping by while walking the wharf.
author: Tyler P.

description: Delicious.  I'm not much of a sweet tooth, but this place was fantastic.  It was fun creating your own ice cream sandwich, and the staff was more than helpful, friendly, and had a great personality.   This is a must-stop for anyone with a craving for sweets.
author: Ben F.

description: Delicious!!! Cookies are perfect, soft and chewy! The ice cream is amazing and is frozen harder than normal so it doesn't melt while you're eating it! Can't wait to go back!
author: Sarah N Anthony U.

description: Was a great bang for the buck I must say, I got a brownie ice cream sandwich combo with a cookie and topped it off with mini m&ms n fudge, the selections are simple so it's easy to make up your mind
author: Mike V.

description: 6 stars if it were possible!! Customer service is amazing and the owner Emma is the one of the sweetest women I have ever met! Almost as sweet as the funfetti snicker doodle ice cream sandwich! Some of the softest cookies I have ever had. Ice cream is amazing. Get the warm press on the brownie or cookie sandwich!! Mmmmmmm good! Definitely going back!
author: Mitch C.

description: This place is fantastic! There is a good selection of ice cream, cookies or brownies, and toppings to choose from. The owner, Emma, is as sweet as her ice cream treats and was so kind and generous to my family. The cookie sandwiches are big! But they'll split the sandwiches in half for you if you'd like to share one. I recommend having your cookie sandwich warmed up because then it's easier to bite into the sandwich. I had a hard time with my first sandwich when I didn't get it warmed up, but it was still delicious, just harder to eat! This ice cream place is well worth your patronage and will leave your ice cream and cookie cravings thoroughly satisfied!
author: Leanna L.

description: So good! Tried the bear bowl with a chocolate chip cookie and the salted caramel fudge and hot caramel topping.
author: Louisa D.

description: awsome build-your-own cookie sandwich experience. If your in for a desert or icecream, this is the place. If you just had your meal in one of the nearby food trucks, be sure to make this your next stop.
author: Dvir A.

description: There are other custom shops, but this was our favorite. A great stop if you are near the Wharf. Fresh cookies and delish ice cream. Leave the diet at the door...
author: Jason W.

description: Love this place!!!! My boyfriend and I came here 30 mins after it opened. The lady that helped us her name is Emma. Emma is the most sweetest and genuine person I have ever met! Her service was amazing even though she was the only one working she did such an amazing job. We mentioned to Emma that her service was amazing and she responded "her motto is that she treats people the way she would want to be treated". Emma we will definitely return here for your amazing desserts and service!
author: Erica M.

description: Great spot! The ice cream sandwich was delicious!!! The woman working there does it all, takes orders, prepares treats, manages when cookies are done baking and gives customers their treats so expect to wait on line but it's worth it!
author: amy t.

description: So good. Quick and tasty dessert- a lot of options and combinations. Great price and a lot of place to sit.
author: Dror M.

description: Took a walk after breakfast before heading home. Luckily we did because we stumbled upon this wonderful place! Layout was nice. Selection great. Customer service excellent. Cookies we got were so delicious. Well priced. I def will be a returning customer. The owner was the sweetest woman ever. Beautiful soul....next time I'm trying a brownie and a donut ice cream sandwhich for the hubby!
author: Gigi C.

description: Great music playing from their speakers, some chill Future Bass. Greeted us with a smile and even gave me an extra topping on inquiry. Ordered the Bear Bowl with Salted Caramel Fudge, and I could see the amount of detail they put into presentation (hot caramel lattice, topping arrangement) which is always appreciated. One of our orders came a bit late, but the owner didn't hesitate to come to our table to give us some free cookies and a sincere apology for our trouble. Overall great experience and bomb ice cream
author: Angelo M.

description: SOOOO yummy! The cookies and brownies were soft and chewy and the ice cream was to die for. All 10 in our party left extremely satisfied... will definitely be back!
author: Keri P.

description: I am super impressed with this amazing new food truck in Fisherman's Wharf! My teenage twin boys have gone 4+ times in the past 3 days. You're going to have to roll us back onto the airplane to go back to Phoenix. The woman working this location is an absolute doll! I see that ownership is responding to these reviews, please tell her we said hello! She'll know exactly who we are! You can tell how dedicated she is to her business. It's been pouring rain the entire time we've been on vacation and she's all smiles and even recognizes us when we stroll on up for more. Try the donut ice cream sandwich! I love how you get to pick all the different aspects of your dessert. This is such a cool concept and I know The Baked Bear is going to do SO well as the weather warms up and tourists come in flocking in. Only $5!
author: Kim K.

description: Oh man. This place is great. It's just a little stand with some outdoor seating, but the ice cream sandwiches are SO GOOD. You can get them customized to however you like and you can really tell the owners care about the customers.
author: Rebecca G.

description: Delicious!! The cookies were fun flavors such as birthday cake. The owner/ cashier was super friendly and inviting. The customer service and the ice cream would keep me coming back for more!
author: Aldrey M.

description: By far one of the best dessert eateries I've found. I'm from Miami and nothing comes close to the baked bear. I tried the white chocolate macadamia and cookies and cream cookie with rocky road ice cream. AMAZING! The service is like no other.
author: Orlando M.

description: The lady who made my cookie ice cream sandwich was really nice and the desert was delicious. Would definitely go back
author: Jay T.

description: Great hidden gem in fishermans wharf. We got a half brownie, half cookie sandwich with salted caramel ice cream. All of the baked goods are very good and the ice cream was very good. She was willing to cut it in half and offered us samples too. Very impressed.
author: Adam B.

description: We came here late one night this summer while vacationing in the city, as it was just down the block from our hotel. Oh my...YUM! Fresh baked hot cookies, and a cookie ice cream sundae...really hit the spot for the nighttime sweet tooth cravings! Super friendly staff and there are places to sit outside and enjoy the views while enjoying your treats!
author: Sylvia A.

description: This place was bomb diggity! You can get a cookie, brownie, donut, or a combination of those for your ice cream sandwich. I chose to get funfetti cookies with birthday cake ice cream and sprinkles as my topping. It was honestly soooo good. The cookies were super soft and delicious. You can also get a hot fudge sundae, bear bowl (warm cookie or brownie in bowl with a scoop of ice cream), or a root beer float. This place was definitely worth stopping at. They should bring their business to Outside lands! :)
author: Kaitlyn M.

description: Awesome idea for a fun dessert. And the location is ideal for those spending some time in the city. Great concept!
author: mike k.

description: I thought the ice cream sandwich was good but not the best I've had. To me the cookie were not that good, they almost tasted old/stale. But the sandwich was ok. The ice cream was pretty good. I would come back probably and try something besides the cookie sandwich.
author: Jeremy ..

description: by far the best ice cream sandwich place I've ever been too! I've gone twice and each time I've met the owner who is the sweetest woman ever; she gave me free cookies both times!  plus the cookies and ice cream taste absolutely amazing... the Spanish hot Chocolate cookie for May is life changing. GO GO GO!!!
author: Colleen V.

description: Super cool idea to make your own ice cream sandwich. Interesting choices available and large portions. Def a fun experience !
author: Hana F.

description: This place puts Cream to shame. I love everything about the Baked Bear, and will choose it over Ghiradelli any day. So far the brownie bear bowl with salted caramel fudge ice cream is my favorite, but I haven't tried a doughnut yet. Maybe next time!
author: Marie R.

description: Everyone: Go here if you are having a bad day, the Baked Bear lady will turn your frown around. Go here even if you are having a good day, these delicious treats and her infectious kindness will make your day even better. The variety here is overwhelming in a good way, this is truly a dream come true if you have a sweet tooth. Each treat is very rich so your sweet tooth will definitely be satisfied! I got a cookie sandwich with one end being a white chocolate macadamia cookie and the other side being a funfetti cookie, with salted caramel fudge ice cream in between YUM. You can tell the ice cream is high quality and the cookies are warm and soft, just the way I like them. This place warms my heart and belly!
author: Anna J.

description: Amazing! The line can get long but well worth the wait. The donut sandwich is mouth watering.
author: Erin K.

description: Super delicious!!!!! Cookies and brownies are warmed with a gooey center. The salted caramel cookie(limited time offering)  is a bomb! The lady there is also super nice and often give out samples of each kind of cookie they sell that day. 5/5 would go again!!
author: Jessica L.

description: Brownie sandwich with coffee ice cream is a MUST!
author: Shay P.

description: So lucky to have found this little treasure.. Cookies stayed soft even with the cold ice cream. The sweet lady who helped us tonight made the cookie/ice cream experience that much more amazing
author: Jennifer M.

description: This place has amazing cookies and Brownies.  The brownie sandwich warmed up is the way to go.   The staff was friendly and allowed you to sample cookies and ice cream.
author: David H.

description:
I ordered Brownie with cookie dough ice cream.. It's soooooo gooooood!!! But for me, I think it's too big to have myself, it's big enough for 2 persons. 

And I'm not sure if she is an owner or just cashier. Anyway, she's really nice to me! Friendly and sincerely. I very appreciated! 

Before I left, I went there again to have mint chip with waffle cone! 

I personally love mint chip ice cream! And this mint chip is freaking tasty!! Again I love it!
author: Salisa B.

description: I ALMOST wish I hadn't found this place because it is so damn naughty but so damn GOOD. We grew up in the UK sans ice cream sandwiches - poor poor British kids. This place takes this fantastic idea and vamps it up. We had salted caramel ice cream on white chocolate & macadamia nut cookies with mini m&ms around the sides. It was insanely good. You can also have them heated but we don't know what it means & we didn't want to ice cream to melt. Maybe we'll try it next time. There will DEFO be a next time.
author: Fi M.

description: Best ice cream sandwich ever! Coffee ice cream with Macadamia Nut cookies topped with whipped cream and chocolate chips! I will be back! A+
author: Greg D.

description: Hands down the best ice cream dessert I've ever had. All of my favorites in one: Fruity Pebbles, chocolate chip cookie and red velvet cookie, and strawberry ice cream. It exceeded my expectations and I was expecting 5 stars.
author: R T.

description: The people are so friendly here! Such great service, unfortunately not nearly as good a some other ice cream places in the area. Over the moon seems to be better quality, and has really fresh/warm cookies. Cookies here don't seem as fresh, although the portion size is bigger.
author: Therese M.

description: Both my husband and I were happy with our treats! I got the chocolate chip cookie with macadamia nut cookie and cookie dough ice cream. It hit the spot!! My husband got the chocolate chip cookie in the pan with rocky road ice cream and whipped cream. We will definitely be going back again soon!!
author: Autumn L.

description: The cookies are amazing and there are so many choices! We're 5 girls from Florida eating ice cream on a cold, rainy day on the bay and loved all of our choices. This place is going to be crazy busy in warmer months! Not to mention that it has the sweetest owner!
author: Jenn H.

description: Freshly made cookies!!! Bomb ice cream!! Really sweet lady, she's the best! Nice place to take a rest on the wharf and enjoy some delicious ice cream sandwiches.
author: Ricardo C.

description: Salted caramel fudge ice cream is incredible. Pairs perfectly with the brownie sandwich.
author: Stanley D.

description: This place was amazing! Definitely my money's worth! The little lady that runs the spot is so nice and humble, which I appreciated! I was in San Fran for 4 days and out of all the places I went to during my trip, she definitely gave me then eat service! Not only was she nice, but she also gave us samples and welcomed us in as first time customers! I definitely recommend this spot. You won't regret it! Definitely better supporting the baked bear over Haagan Daz all over the city. Take my advice! ;)
author: Kerry H.

description: Went to this place with my girl friend after a few days of walking past it and finally craving an ice cream sandwich and this place did not disappoint. I got the chocolate chip cookie sandwich with cookies and cream ice cream and it was so good. The cookie was delicious and was not over baked, but nice and soft and had a great flavor and so did the ice cream. I thought the pricing was good for such a scrumptious cookie sandwich. I'm originally from LA and will miss this spot once I go home, but is now a go to once I'm in SF.
author: Gustavo C.

description: Came here with my friends on New Years Eve for some late night ice cream. We were greeted by a lovely lady with such a great attitude. Having just had horrible service at a nearby restaurant a change in service was refreshing. She also gave us samples of the cookies. She let me try the pecan & pretzel one AMAZING!!! it was soft in the middle crunchy on the outside. So good! Overall I would come back just for EMMA!!! she is the owner of this cute little spot & her customer service & friendliness makes me wanna come here with more friends it's a good place to chill & enjoy some good ice cream. They even sell coffee !!! Thanks EMMA & her team for the experience !!!
author: Stephanie P.

description: Did not enjoy my ice cream sandwich at all! Donut was stale, ice cream was bad... didn't even eat more than a couple bites.
author: K. D.

description:
The moment we got there she gave us a complimentary cookie to try before ordering and she was extremely generous. Most importantly, the icecream was DELICIOUS! Too bad I don't live here otherwise I would definitely come back :) 5/5 love it

Ps. Try the brownie and ask for the fudge on top!
author: Tarek K.

description: I work at the Fisherman's Wharf Marriott so me and my co-workers are unfortunately there on a regular day to day basis. :) The owner EMMA is SOOOO AMAZING! She really makes the place shine & have personality. She is always asking people to taste, try, and sample different things. By now she knows I get two scoops of coffee with health bar. I'm not as adventurous as my co-workers, but they get the works with the cookie or donuts with topping and they all rave about the place, but more importantly Emma. It's not what do you want, here it is, and bye, she is the most personable owner I've met in a long time, everyone around here adores her. As the weather is getting nicer, the lines are getting longer, and with so many options to choose from can be a little frustrating for someone trying to sneak a break to ice cream, but it's always worth the wait... You won't be disappointed, and don't forget to Tip Emma :)
author: Mikaela J.

description: This is one of the most delicious & great place to go in SF ! We came here at 9PM & the owner was the only lady working & she attended us in the most nicest way ever ! Great customer service ! She even gave us cookies for free ! Will come again completely recommend !!!
author: Nina M.

description: A must go to in San Francisco! So good we went twice during our stay. The weather was cloudy but couldn't resist! You won't be disappointed. The owner is extremely sweet and helpful!
author: Myleena T.

description: this place was so good!!! the lady working was so nice!!! glad my friend and I stopped by and found it.  the bear batter was delicious and it went well with the donut. her red velvet cookie was so good too.
author: April G.

description: We loved Baked Bear!! I don't know what was better - the delicious custom ice cream sandwiches or the kind hospitality of the owner. Highly recommended!
author: Stacey W.

description: The ice cream was amazing. I think that is definitely the selling point. The cookies were perfect for an ice cream sandwich, very firm. The staff was super friendly. I'll go back for sure.
author: Raeanne J.

description: Such a fun little place with the most pleasant lady, the owner no less running the window and making and baking the cookies. I ordered the oatmeal snicker noodle cookie, vanilla ice cream coated with slivered almonds. The price was outstanding and my ice cream sandwich was huge. Loved!
author: Jonni M.

description: Definitely worth trying. I like that we can customize and make our own ice cream sandwiches. I ended up choosing combinations that were too sweet together for my taste. The staff were great too!
author: Helen L.

description: Soooooo gooooood!!! We saw this place on the way to get dinner and couldn't resist. What a great decision! These sandwiches were amazing. We got the chocolate chip cookies and those would have been good enough on there own. Then we added the Bear Batter and fruity pebbles. Friendly staff and chill music makes this a can't miss. Can't wait to go again!!
author: Dan K.

description: Amazing gluten free cookies and ice cream!  Great afternoon treat after walking around Fishermans Wharf. I highly recommend funfetti cookie with birthday cake ice cream (although this isn't gluten free).
author: Dan T.

description: I am a health nut, and this is the first time in a year that I've finished my dessert. The sandwich was amazing, and the value for money was great. The atmosphere they created was really happy and welcoming too. There is a long line, because they dedicate their attention to one creation at a time, and it's very much worth the wait. I got chatting with the owner, and, in the midst of our conversation, she accidentally mixed up the ice cream flavours. When I pointed that out, she fixed it, and surprised me with a complimentary cookie. Service and attitude was above and beyond.
author: Ani V.

description: What a cool concept.  Loved the create your own custom ice cream sandwich.  Cookies were fresh and tasty.  Ice cream was really good as well.
author: Joel V.

description: How can you not want to eat here??!!  Amazing!  Customize your own ice cream sandwhich, donut sandwhich, etc!!!  Owner is super sweet:)
author: Abby N.

description: The baked bear is the best dessert I have had in the last couple years of my life. If you are in fishermans wharf I would 100 percent go there.
author: Ethan K.

description: Amazing !!!! The coffee ice cream with the salted Carmel cookie was like nothing I have ever had. The employee was so kind and let me try everything before I made my personal ice cream sandwich. Would definitely go back and recommend it to anyone.
author: Ashley B.

description: BEST ICE CREAM SANDWICH EVER!!! Unlike similar places who uses factory made cookie dough, this place makes it's baked goods and ice cream from scratch...yummmmy!! Super friendly staff especially the owner who makes you feel so welcome and makes a picture perfect sandwich! To put a cherry on top (no pun intended), they cater!! Who wouldn't want ice cream sandwiches at their next party!! Sign me up please!! If you are in the area, you MUST stop by.  You will leave with sweet tooth satisfied and a smile on your face from the great service you receive!!
author: Bashar A.

description: This place was amazing! Very friendly staff! Delicious soft freshly baked cookies and yummy ice cream!
author: Stefanie D.

description: Very generous lady. Me and my gf visited and got an ice cream sandwich and the bear bowl. They where both delicious so I tipped her 5 dollars. In return, she gave us 6 different free cookies!!!
author: Frank R.

description: Amazing! I'm a cookie snob and only eat homemade. I tried a sample and it was so good we bought a dozen to take home. The wonderful woman that runs the shop only makes the cookie experience better!
author: Kristi D.

description: Stopped by today at the Baked Bear...one of the best things in San Francisco!  Owner was so nice and offer lots of samples.  Highly recommend!
author: Lori H.
